text: When I think of Lagunitas, I dont think of doppel weizens, so this was a surprise. Very nice, dark gold an aromatic. Banana and spice, honey, and sweet maltiness.

Pours a cloudy marmalade, one finger, frothy white head, sticky. Aroma is big, stone fruit, caramel, rich florals... Very inviting. Malts really shine on this, caramel, peach, earth, spice...traces of woodiness, white grape and alcohol in the finish pretty good but a hair disappointing after a hot start.

Bottle - good size foamy head, dark gold color, sweet malty aroma and flavor with some mild fruity esters, smooth finish, easy drinking so watch out for the increased alcohol, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma is wheat, fruit/lemon and big sugar/candy. The flavor is citrus/light lemon, wheat, fruit, slick texture and a mix of spicy and slightly nutty in the finish.
Bottle: Not my style. Lots of aroma and flavor but way too much banana ester and a palate thats excessively sweet. Lacks the bitterness or acid to support it.
Bottle pours amber with a white head. Aroma of yeast, malts, biscuits and honey. Taste is banana, caramel, honey and some grains.

Aromas of peaches, mangoes, and overly sweet caramel. Taste is peaches, mangoes, salt water taffy, caramel. Finish has some wheat and pine tar. After warming banana esters and clove appear in the middle of the mouth.
Pours a hazy copper color with a smallish white head. Booze, banana, clove, floral, biscuit and yeast aroma and flavors. Medium body and lively carbonation Booze, clove and bread finish.

Pours orange-amber into the glass, with a nice eggshell head that leaves window-wash lacing. The nose is of orange, tangerine and mixed citrus zest (some lemon-lime predominant), amongst citric hops. Orange, tangerine and lemon-lime flavors mingle with a nice, lightly peppering hop, finishing with a curt, citric zest/peel bitterness. The integration here is perfect: a combination of a medium-full body and zesty mouthfeel that keeps the palate active, concentrating on citrus notes, alongside nice citric hop bitters. I do not use the word "citrus" so much unless it is in tandem with the essential aspects of the brew. Juicy, lively, complex-for-days, this is a very unique take on the Weizen-Bock style... and one that craves for another... and another. Superior brew here! Kudos to Lagunitas on this offering. I would take this any time, any day!

Pours a cloudy orange with a medium white head. The rather pleasing aroma contains a combination of orange and banana, with lesser amounts of wheat, honey, and bread. The taste is a bit sweet and has a mild, lingering bitterness. Orange is still big, with wheat being the main compliment. It has undertones of lemon, spice, banana, and just the faintest hint of caramel. The aftertaste is a short, gentle wheat. Its medium in body, with a smooth, creamy texture, and about average in carbonation. This is very easy drinking, and nothing makes you believe that its 9%. This is good.
Hoppy orange zest and bread with a wheat tang and a slight taste of aspirin. Much too hoppy for a bock.
Bottle at the RateBeer DC April Fools Tasting. Thanks Alejandro! Clear golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of malt, honey. Tastes of malt, honey, citrus. Medium body with a dry finish.

Bready malty aroma with citrus orange hops, spicy peppery yeast, un ripened banana.
Pours a cloudy golden amber color with creamy white head
Sweet bready malt flavor with citrus hops. Yeast present but overpowered by hop.
Medium full bodied, medium co2, lingering hop bitterness. 
Leave it to Lagunitas to turn an awesome beer style into an IPA.... it's an okay beer just not what I was expecting or hoping for. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy , amber color . Big , white head. Aroma of citrus , wheat malt and hint of banana. Moderate sweetness in taste. Tropical fruits, yeasts and raisins in flavor. Great, although Americanized weizenbock.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From a bottle at the RB DC tasting on April Fools Day 2017. Pours a hazy gold with an off white head. Aromas of lemon and toast. Caramel flavors. Soft, smooth finish.
Nice weizenbock. Some light citrus and a little florals. Great balance. Light sweet finish. I always love weizenbocks. Subtle but excellent like Coen brothers movies. Bottle thanks to ajax.

Bottle shared with Frank. Aroma is tropical fruit, pine, very hoppy for some reason, slight malt, weird. Appearance is golden amber, light crisp carbonation, slightly hazy. Taste is hops, tropical fruit, pine, malt, resin, this doesnt taste anything like the style would implicate. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, pine tropical fruit aftertaste. Overall, is this the right beer? I feel like they bottles their IPA and called it this. It tastes nothing like a Weizenbock.
Yellow color, and a white head. Some jaze. Surprisingly hoppy, aome sheat sweetness. Also some alcohol in the flavor. Some lemon. A little sweetness.
This is distinctively Lagunitas. It has their house/base beer characteristic. Flavors of banana, citrus, honey, pineapple. Reminds me a bit of Vitus but not quite at that level overall.

Bomber pours a hazy dark golden color with lasting tight white head that leaves spots of lacing. Aroma has lemon, biscuits, wheat bread, and honey. Taste is initially sweet, with honey and citrus that I never would have expected for a Weizen Bock. The finish is hoppy and dry. Body is medium with a silky mouthfeel. The 8,7% alcohol is well hidden. This is an easy pleasure to drink and reasonably priced, if hard to classify. Ill be sure to try this one again.

Slightly murky orange-gold with ltitle head. Smell is rich, fruity, vanilla, grain, apple strudel. Taste is classic banana/apricot/clove weizen flavor turned up to 10 with a big hop presence. Aftertaste is not as boozy as I expected. Very thick palate - some more carbonation would have helped a lot here.

Pours a hazy orange color with a thin white bubbly head. Aroma of wheat, bubblegum, banana, tropical fruit, and a slight sour earthy aroma. Taste has a big wheat flavor with some citrus tang. A touch of tropical fruit and hop and maybe some brown sugar. Finish has a touch of sour, touch of bitter with a little alcohol. Light to medium, silky body and moderate carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 28, 2017 Bottle in Seattle. Smaller foam, malty clear, rich orange. Sweet spicy malt. Bitter, sharp alcohol. Richer wheat edge, a light ester-banana note in distance. Tasty but a bit harsh. Astringent alcohol.

Pours two fingers of head on a hazy straw body.
Aroma is mild fruits, some bread.
Taste is bread, mild lemon bitterness, banana. Super easy to drink. 
Texture is smooth.

A bright golden color with a white head. The aroma contains some lemons, biscuit, wheat and alcohol. The flavor is slightly sweet with some bananas, lemons, and wheat bread. Way too drinkable for 9%. I wouldnt guess more than 5 honestly. Overall a nice beer at a nice price.

650 ml. 8.7% abv. Hazy, burnt orange pour with a lasting film of cream on top. Big aroma of orange zest, bread and honey. Flavor is the same mix. Tasty, but the uber hopping typical of Lagunitas drowns out nearly all of the Bavarian yeast character. Maybe a hint of banana, but I think its just wishful thinking on my part. Medium-plus bodied with mostly smooth, medium carbonation and not a hint of the abv. Way drier than is typical of a bock.

22 ounce bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 2/25/2017. Pours slightly hazy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky off white head with great retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lasts. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings down the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Fantastic appearance. Aromas of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, apricot, mango, melon, lemon, pear, banana, pepper, clove, light bubblegum, wheat, bread, light honey, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Great complexity and balance of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, apricot, mango, melon, lemon, pear, banana, pepper, clove, light bubblegum, wheat, bread, light honey, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Light-moderate floral/grassy bitterness and yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, apricot, mango, melon, lemon, pear, banana, pepper, clove, wheat, bread, herbal, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitter/spiciness balance, and zero cloying/astringent flavors after the finish. Lightly increasing dryness from bitter/spiciness as well. Medium carbonation and medium-plus body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy, and lightly sticky balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Minimal warming alcohol for 8.7%. Overall this is a great hoppy weizen bock style. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of citrus/tropical hops, fruity/spicy yeast, and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink for the ABV. It feels quite different than I remember from the original batch years ago. More hoppy and less hazy/yeasty, but is really well balanced between the two. Still a very enjoyable offering.

Golden pour with thin white cap that clings. Aroma is slightly boozy with some hop scents of citrus rind and a hint of sweet. Smells nothing like a Weizenbock. Flavor is good, and as with most items from these folks, its unique. More like a wheat-based IPA, though none of the telltale wheat characteristics. Flavor follow the nose mostly. Its ever so slightly sweet and never too bitter, but still citrus-rind-ey. Long way from Vitus as others have mentioned.
22 ounce bottle from Whole Foods. Deep clean orange with no weizen characteristics at all. Big and hoppy of course. Still good.

Aromas is like an apple smoked sausage (some sweet notes but mostly salty, savory, & lightly spiced). Really weird nose on this one...anyway, tastes a bit different from the nose. Arrives with yeasty esters, bananas, green apples, cloves, and bready malts. Strong coriander seed note in the middle that takes over. Finishes with that salty, savory note found in the aroma. Some black pepper even comes up as it warms. Medium body with a moderate fizz that helps it from being soup broth. Overall an interesting beer, for sure, but not really enjoyable for the whole big-ass bottle.
Bottle from the Beer Trappe. Aroma of cloves, fruit, and malt. Very sweet taste.
A solid 8.7% alcohol doesnt hurt. Flavor is great, though a little too Americanized to seem truly legit.

looks golden orange small head 
smells like cheddar or gouda at first then pee
taste sweet citrusy and boozy some metal.
feels heavy and smooth and viscous
kind of a mess but not terrible. none of the qualities of a good weizenbock. but its an ok strong wheat ale. it reminds me of a thicker smoother and more boozy hopfen-weisse only not on that level.

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of biscuit, bread, slight yeast, hints of orange, touch of lemon, hints of yeast. Taste was a mix of bread, biscuit, lemon, orange, touch of spice, touch of white fruit, finishing slightly sweet, some spice.

Hazy golden to amber colored liquid. Smaller, stable head of cream colored bubbles. Malt and grain aromas mix with light fruit and doughy yeast. Sweet malt and wheat flavors. Hints of banana and light spice, both yeast and alcohol induced. Stomach is starting to warm up. A little sharp in spots but a quite nice doppelweizen. I could definitely sit with this by the fire pit on a cool fall evening. 7/11

spotty lacing... the brew is hazed golden orange.

Nose shows big pulpy overripe banana ... lite clove balances slightly in the phenol dept.... 

Flavor is more in the lite clove and background spice phenol element.. banana comes out swinging with some lite toasty bread points... pink bubblegum meshes with everything on the finish making for a complex yet sorta messy end.

Body is sorta thick even given the style.. needs more than a lite carbonation... decent at best..

January 28th, 2012 - I havent seen this since my sampling back in 2012, but Id love to see it around again. It lacks some of that hard-edged sweetness that appears now and again in batches of beer from Lagunitas, exhibiting a yeasty flavor with a touch of bitterness, though a crisper kind of bitter, less hop dependent. Thats wreathed by dry toffee and light caramel notes, and with a sticky string of butterscotch. But the draw for me is the yeast, which in the flavor grants a great fermentable depth and umami. Meanwhile, the smell also employs the yeast, where it goes off more of a wheat and fresh dough kind of scent, complemented by a little white grape and even a smear of peanut butter. Curious, but the taste is the star here, and the object of focus. I hope this comes back someday - would love to see how it tastes with a few more years of sampling beers under my somewhat larger belt.
Rated based on notes taken 20 Dec 2011 -- This went well will steaks for dinner. Sweet malty weizen flavor that could pair well with any rich, robust meaty dish.

"nice brew, especially at this price. bubble gum, banana, and clove in abundance. 9% hidden well, though full bodied. nice n smooth, tasty brew. i was curious how Lagunitas would pull off a non-hoppy ass ale, and they pretty much nailed it."
On tap at Taps in Petaluma. Pours a hazy bright amber color with a bit of head. Large malty flavor with a hint of banana.

22oz bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a thin white bubbly head. Aroma of wheat, bubblegum, banana, tropical fruit, and a slight sour earthy aroma. Taste has a big wheat flavor with some citrus tang. A touch of tropical fruit and hop and maybe some brown sugar. Finish has a touch of sour, touch of bitter with a little alcohol. Light to medium, silky body and moderate carbonation.
Bottle thanks to Sean! It was good but seemed to be a one note beer. Smells and tastes like banana bread soaked in beer.
Bottle. Pours cloudy gold with white head. Nose and taste of banana, coriander, sweet malt, wheat malt and light caramel. Medium body.

Bottle pour..light amber/orangish color..expecting a bit darker..tiny bubbles rising..intriguing nose of banana..clove..and as some have stated cider..sweet malt and indeed some type of marmalade/jam..this is a new style for me..so not sure what to expect..but definitely has good Belgian qualities and flavor profile..mouthfeel is enjoyable and initially hides the abv..banana bread spiked clove takes center stage on sip and does have that familiar Belgian goodness...quite easy drinking.this is a good hybrid taste offering and a bit off the beaten path for lagunitas..worth seeking out..

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2013 Type: 22-oz. bomber  
Glass: Pilsner glass  
From: Clems Bottle House and Deli 
Price: $5.99 
Misc.: N/A

Poured an amber, orange, hazy color with 1-2 fingers of khaki white head that dissipated very quickly. Minimal lacing and poor retention.

Lots of different smells that came together rather nicely. Got sour fruit, melon, peach, mango and other tropical flavors, banana, cloves, caramel, floral hops and citrus hops (orange, tangerine and lemon). Some unknown spices late. 

Tasted very smooth. Got cloves, peach, mango, melon, lemon and tangerine, just a tropical feel. Could taste the alcohol. Surprisingly bitter finish.

Medium body. Oily-to-creamy texture. Lively (above average) carbonation. Astringent, bitter finish.

Really enjoyed this beer. A sweet doppel weizen with a nice alcohol bite.

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

The beer appears very hazy and light orange in color. The head is dense and pure white, measuring an inch thick. The aroma brings alcohol, fruit, yeast, spice. Banana and clove in the flavor. Pretty sweet. Malt and spices are secondary to sweet bananas. Medium bodied with a creamy feel. The mouthfeel is my favorite aspect of the beer. Overall, a decent example of the style, but I much prefer Aventinus.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-11-2011
Good beer for its type.  Its got a slight after taste that may be from the time in my beer fridge.  Im not holding against the bottle and Ill be back to try it again.

pours a cloudy orange-yellow with a thin off white head.

smell is faint.

taste is of pear, peach, some caramel, malt, and sweet fruit.  ends smooth.

Bomber bottle poured into proper hefe class. Deep orange amber, stiff white head. Proper appearance, proper banana yeast spice citrus aroma and taste. Really good Doppel, wish theyd make it a regular.
bananas, oranges, yeasty, dry apricots. Very smooth banana bread body, clovey, slightly bready and bit more hoppy than usual, but excellent balance and alcohol well hidden for 9%

Bottle. Pours a dark orange, with a medium sized white head that left no lacing.  The nose is full of banana and clove and other spices, bready malt. Tastes moderately sweet with some light bitterness. Flavor is similar to the aroma, full of spice and bready malt. Finishes with some bitterness that keeps the sweetness in check. Medium body and not too boozy for being 9%. A was mildly but still pleasantly surprised by this one. Very enjoyable.
Pours a clear golden color with a small white head. Smells and tastes very sweet. A little too sweet for my taste.

THOUGHTS: Nice. Fairly light for a weizen bock. Hid the high ABV incredibly well. Lots of wheat, yeast, apples and citrus. Intense flavors and aroma. Only lacking any roasted or darker malts.
TECHNICAL: Bottle. Poured a very hazy, light to medium orange with a small to average, slightly off-white head that mostly diminished and left barely fair lacing. The aroma had moderate to heavy cookie, cake and wheat; very light caramel; moderate spicy yeast; banana; apple cider; and some citrus. The initial flavor was light to moderately sweet, moderately acidic and light to moderately sour; while the finish was moderately sweet, acidic and sour. There was light caramel, wheat, spicy yeast, apple cider, citrus, orange, banana, cookie, cake, a little tea, and fruit syrup. The medium body was slightly syrupy, quite creamy and also fairly oily with very fizzy and tingly carbonation and a lightly astringent finish.

Slightly hazed amber with a thin off-white head.  Aroma of bready yeast, fruit, light alcohol, sugar and sweet malt.  Taste of sugar, bready malt, alcohol, malt, needs some balancing out here.  Drank this one while the Packers lost to the niners.

650ml bottle. Nice gold, unfiltered, apricot colour with a moderate creamy head. Aroma is fruity, bananas and raisin, a light syrup and little spicy. A bit more herbal hops than Id expect for the style and a fruity tartness. Touch of a savory pastry in the back of the mouth. Lots of body. Overall, lots of flavour and a good synergy of Germany and California.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange-gold with a prolific billowy head. The aroma is characteristic: clove, banana, bread, some vanilla and Belgian-esque funk. The taste is up-front malty, and as reminiscent of a Belgian ale as anything German. There are notes of holiday spices, caramel, and bread. There is a mild bitter finish and the alcohol content only shows up as a pleasant warmness afterward. Full-bodied and complex.

It pours off-medium cloudy amber with orange tones and a tremendous, puffy head.  The aroma is vibrant with sweetened wheat, caramel malts, yeast, brown sugar, Allspice, and pear.  The aroma reminds me less of a Dobbel Weizen and more of an Abbey Style Dubbel. The bod7y is creamy and medium.  The taste erupts with the same sensations as the aroma with maybe a touch of booze kicking in at the end. But overall, I enjoyed this one very much.
Taken from old notes. Cloudy amber pour with a nose of yeasts. Smooth taste that slowly gives way to a bitter finish. A little sweetness in there too.
Its very yeasty, not too much hops or malt but just Belgium-y. Wouldnt buy it again for myself.
Weizen bock, really? If I tasted this blind I would ahve sworn it was a Belgian ale. Nice shapr bitter finish with minor alcohol burn, delicious!
The aroma is malty and yeasty with incense, fruit, and spices. The appearance is amber with a haze. The taste is like the aroma and grainy. The palate is smooth. Overall a nice beer but not perfect.

22 oz. bottle for $6.45 at Berts. This was worth every penny! Used a Weizen glass. Showing a real clear yellow color with thick foamy head. Does have an amber hue to it. Nose is a delightful bouquet of clove, banana and malt. Amazing flavor and if I didnt know better, I would have thought I was drinking a bad ass Hefeweizen from Germany. Great vibrant clove, over ripe banana, sweet malt and nice yeast body.  Medium-full bodied with fairly heavy carbonation. Feels smooth with a spicy and lightly sweet finish. ABV is nowhere to be found. However, a bit of warming on the way down. Fantastic weizenbock and a grand slam homerun from Lagunitas.

Pours a burnished orange cloudy and murky. Pours with a very small foamy head in fact pretty much just a smear atop the surface. A surface smear.
looks well carbonated.
A very aromatic beer here with plenty of wheat malts and yeasty esters giving a pronouned banana and clove bouquet.
Taste of this medium bodied beer is quite flavor with an abundance of malts and banana and clove esters. Flavor is solid and strong and can stand on its own as it warms unlike others that tend to wash out as they warm. A bit sharp or dry with a bittering finish.
A good solid wheat and something to be proud of.

Pours a slightly cloudy medium orange color with almost no head. Smells like candy. Aromas of caramel, toffee, butterscotch, and yeast.  Taste is pretty sweet and very yummy. Almost tastes like toffee ice cream. Very good. You get just enough yeast on the finish to make it unique. Really good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from Healthy Spirits. Pours cloudy amber with a rich off-white head and a fruity aroma. There is a yeast-laden wheat flavor that is quite robust with a bitter finish.

Pours a deep orange color with a medium foamy white head that dissipates slowly. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Cereal malts, bananas and yeast in the nose. Medium body with flavors of toasted malt, bread bread, yeast and fruit. The finish is sweet with a yeast and bubblegum aftertaste. Above average overall.
Pours a mid orange with sweet banana.  Sticky cloves with banana notes that hide the ABV.  Nice use of the yeast to make a long finish.

On tap at Frisco's Grille & Taproom in Columbia, MD. 

Very hazy, pale amber with small head and fair lacing. 

Aroma of banana, cloves and spice. 

Taste of banana, wheat, cinnamon, cloves and sweet malt. 

Full body and mild carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At Lagunitas with Jeff et al. Loved it. All the great German flavors, malt, caramel, ban Ana and holiday spice, smooth, but with a bit of bright hops playing in the background. Inspired.

22oz. bottle.  Big fruity and spicy nose, with notes of clove, banana, light caramel sweetness, orange peel, dough and faint apple.  Hazy medium-dark golden color with a fine, lasting, uneven head.  Flavor is sweet, malt, spicy and estery throughout, with suggestions of banana, bubblegum, clove, allspice, honey, caramel, doughy bread, flowers, faint citrus, some faint leafy, herbal tones and a modicum of peppery bitterness that appears at the finish.  Effervescent and gently acidic and warming on the palate, for all of the sweetness present, this coupled with the late bitterness ultimately has a nice refreshing effect.  Body is fairly full.  Highly enjoyable and tasty.  Who knew Lagunitas was so good at making German styles?

Appearance: a gentle haze obscures the colors of a flickering flame while a soft bready head lingers as a thick blanket. Lace abounds.

Nose: yeasty, spicy, doughy, and tropical all at the same time. Stewed peaches, apricots, bananas, and tropical fruit skins. Coconuts in the raw. White pepper and cumin. Whole pineapples. Fermented honey-soaked grains.

Palate: yum! Fermented honey and grains  crispy, crunchy, honeyed. Raw and unfettered than spiced with warmth lingering in the chest. Banana skins, white pepper, ginger, and cumin are a massive presence in the middle. Chewy yeasty dough. Banana weaves throughout. Carbonation dissipates rather quickly, leaving about a half full glass with a silky denser boozier spicier chewier presence.

Final Thoughts: for as much as I enjoyed the Bavarian-style Doppelweizen from Lagunitas, I find myself not remembering much of what I tasted, even as I write them down once more, this time in a review. Definitely a good beer, unique, but lacking a certain je ne sais quoi to remember it by.

Sampled on 4/22/2012. This weizen bock pours a medium orange gold color from a 22oz bottle. Medium sized white foamy head with nice retention and good lacing. The aroma is fruity and sweet, banana, clove, with some orange and orange peel. And yes there are some hops as well. It wouldnt be a Lagunitas beer if it did not have some hops now would it? A medium to full bodied weizen bock. The malts are fruity, caramel and sweet, with a bunch of banana and clove. The hops are herbal and spicy with a touch of citrus. Lively carbonation. Nice yeasty flavor, with a lot of banana. Its hoppy for a weizen bock, but not for a Lagunitas beer. Was someone physically holding the brewer back fro adding EMH (even more hops). The yeast and the hops shine through in this beer, with a touch of hops at the finish. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Bomber.  Pours a cloudy light amber with an average sized head.  Aromas of banana, clove, wheat in the nose.  Taste follows suit with the yeastiness usually associated with German Weizens.  If this didnt say Lagunitas on the label and was made in Germany, I believe many people would think that this one of the best Weizen Bocks in the world.  However, its made in California from a brewer known for their IPAs, so they knock it down a notch.
On tap at rattle with Anthony and James.  Sweet hefe and thick orange upfront.  Very sweet and supple, has a tinny finish that throws it off.

Pours a slightly amber cloudy orange with thin white head, minimal lacing.  Aroma of wheat, german yeast, citrus, hay, floral hops, and caramel.  Flavor matches well, but is a little bit sweet and ends extremely bitter in the back of the mouth.  Nice brew, but held back just slightly.

Picked this up at Berts Better Beers in Hookset on 4-7-12. Poured into a Mikasa Pilsner glass at 60 Degrees F.

A - Poured a 2-finger white head that subsided very fast. The beer is a 3 on the SRM scale in color. Its a tan to golden tan beer very clear, very beautiful. A very very nice beer!

S - Wow. Excellent dry german yeast scent hits me almost instantly. The honey malts take over next followed by some kind of fruit like apricots, mango or pineapple. Its a very German beer but a lot sweeter than most Bavarian style Weizens Ive had.

T - Oh yes. There is that classic German taste. Dry, light fruits, wheat and roastiness. Theres a walnut characteristic to this beer and a bit of pine resin from the small amount of hops added. It has a lot of characteristics youd find in a Pinot Grigio that had set out for a while and allowed to breathe and then force carbonated to some intense levels. Its very German but also very unique. This is an extremely tasty beer!

M - 95% carbonation on a mouth swish. Medium bodied and lingering honey and syrup taste after swallowing.

O - Yeah, I LOVE this beer. Its everything I love about German beers and nothing that I dont love.

(Une autre grosse partagée avec rodenbach99)  Une robe embrouillée qui est toute orangée.  Un anneau de mousse, sans plus.  Un nez amusé par les bananes et le citron.  Du girofle et du caramel.  Une présence accompagnatrice de lalcool.  Des saveurs qui vont dans le même sens.  Un alcool qui transporte des fruits et des épices.  Un goût de caramel et de sirop de maïs.  Une bouche justement ronde.  Une texture qui enrobe.  Un effet modéré qui provient des bulles.  Une finale appréciable à souhait, épicée et chaleureuse.  Une autre bonne proposition de cette maison.
hazy deep orange color, aroma of wheat, clove, yeast, orange, booze, flavors of coriander, clove, yeast, bitter orange, booze, wheat, med body, high carbonation, lagunitas never lets me down

Bottle. Moderate malt aromas of cookie and cereal, orange for the hops, light dough for the yeast, with over-ripe banana, honey, fig and a hint of vinegar in the background, Head is small, frothy to fizzy, off-white with no lacing and is mostly diminishing. Color is hazy yet sparkling medium orange. Flavor starts lightly to moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic and moderately bitter. Palate is medium, a little slick with a lively carbonation. This is a fantastic beer and a great representation of a Weizen Bock.

Style et résumé: Weizenbock de qualité à boire froide.  
Comment: Bouteille de 1 pinte 6 oz. un gros merci à mon ami Patrick. 
Description: Bière de belle couleur orange, malheureusement elle ne mousse pas. Le nez est tout à fait à point avec des notes de gingembre, banane, clou de girofle. Les épices sont fort à propos. Il est très invitant. La bouche est pleine de saveurs de gingembre, de la banane, clou de girofle, du blé, des épices et une amertume dalcool, malgré que les 34 IBU peuvent y être pour quelque chose.  
Note:  8/10

Draft at Tuskies. Pours yellow with a very thin white head that fades quickly. Slight hint of esters on the nose. A bit of alcohol and some hoppiness. Finish is fairly clean. Havent yet had a weizen bock I really dug.
Bomber.   Pours a hazy gold orange color, no head at all.  Strong Clove aroma, carbonation is strong, thick, sour finish.  Enjoyable beer, strong and different.

Bottle. Cloudy orange-amber with a short foamy white head. Aroma is sweet malt with strong clove, wheat, banana, and bubblegum. Taste is sweet malt, candied fruit, clove, wheat notes, big bubblegum, banana and yeast notes. Body is medium with a strong, prickly carbonation and mild warmth from the alcohol. Finishes with more wheat, clove, bubblegum, candied banana, and sweet, chewy malt.

A - Pours a cloudy golden-yellow with a finger of frothy white head. The head fades down fairly quickly leaving behind just a touch of lace.

S - Aroma is a strong mix of banana and clove with some bubblegum, wheat, spice, and yeast.

T - Starts off with some banana and bubblegum with wheat and a touch of light spice. Through the middle, the clove and yeast flavors start to come through with a bit more bubblegum flavor and some more sweet wheat. The finish is a mix of sweet wheat, banana, yeast, bubblegum, and some lingering spices and a hint of citrus and other fruity esters.

M - Medium-full bodied with fairly heavy carbonation. Feels smooth with a spicy and lightly sweet finish.

D - Very drinkable. Very good weizenbock with some really nice yeast flavors with a great balance throughout.
Coppery orange color with a thin whitish head. Crisp, fruity, and just a bit tart with a yeasty flavor. Strong and full, but still summery. A very interesting beer.

Huge banana esters dominate the nose backed up by sweet/sour wheat, raisins and some alcohol. Clear tan body is topped by a shy white head that recedes rapidly to a slight ring. Flavour follows the aroma but is perhaps a bit too sweet up front. Medium body doesnt really have enough carbonation for style.  Some warming.  Doesnt really work for me.  Tulip glass.  A little above fridge temperature. Bottle purchased at Brewery Creek in February 2012.

Pours a rich yellow brown with generous white head.
Fresh, strong weizenbock with all the expected flavors.
Bold flavor,crisp finish-nice beer
(bottle) hazy orange gold with quickly fading white head. Aroma of wheat malt, clove, a little banana. Flavor is bavarian weizen - banana, clove, yeast, light wheat malt.
12oz pour into Sniffer, nice fruit filled aroma, strong smooth flavor with a nice almost peachy aftertaste a solid beer

22oz bomber poured into Weizen glass.  
Aroma:  lots of banana, some orange, vanilla, hay, slight alcohol smell, hoppy
Appearance:  Firey orange pour, very hazy.  less than 1 finger head that faded quickly to a thin layer
Taste:  very sweet with a bit of bitter finish, also slightly sour.  bit of hops but not like alot of other lagunitas brews
Palate:  medium body and creamy texture.  lively carbonation.  sour/bitter finish but not too strong
Overall:  Very refreshing beer. Not sure why its a fall/winter seasonal.  I would drink this in the heat of summer.  Alcohol could be hidden better but its not too heavy.  I like this alot.  More banana flavor as it warms.

The nose is fruity, but dense. Lots of banana and peach. Some clove and pepper. Very nice. The taste follows suite with a healthy banana presence, as well as peach, apple, and fig. Herbal with a faint tart spiciness in the finish. Very nice!

Sampled from a 22 oz brown bottle this beer poured a cloudy apricot color with a medium sized foamy yellow-white head that left a bit of lacing. The aroma was lemon, banana and a bit of wheat. The flavor was sweet bread, banana, clove, bubblegum and a touch of citrus with undertones of pine, bread and honey. The finish was long bread, honey, banana and clove. Fairly full bodied. Well done.

hazy gold in color. small amount of head that dissipates quickly. aroma of banana is most prominent with spicy cloves bringing up the rear. definitely belgian yeast at work here. taste follows the nose. big banana and clove flavors. not as effervescent as i would have liked for a wheat beer.
Bomber:  Pours a cloudy yellow orange with a thin white head, aroma has bananas and clove, starts and ends lightly bitter, strong carbonation, sticky mouthfeel.

banana nut bread bomb! leave it to lagunitas to make this beer. its atleast a double hefeweisen, if not more. just a huge unflitered german style wheat, very banana, very german. most german american wheat up their with kellerweis.

Refrigerated bomber poured into a weizen glass.  Pours translucent deep golden with lighter top and bottom and small white head that dissapates quickly.  Some lacing, expected more carbonation, medium body, syrupy texture, and nice banana aroma.  Taste is sour yeasty banana, some alcohol, and finishes with some bitter hops then dry.  A little too much alcohol for me, but still pretty good.

Medium tasting, smooth full bodied start and a floral, hoppy after taste. Its appearance had a orange, brown, color and was a bit hazy.  It had minimal head and soft carbonation.  Overall, I greatly enjoyed this beer and would recommend it to anyone who enjoys rich flavored, brown ales.
Cloudy gold,small white head.Yeasty banana nose.Spicy yeast profile, banana,bubblegum, coriander.Lifeless, lacks carbo for style

Hazy light gold color with an average persistent head and good spider lacing.  Excellent weizen bock!  Big caramel wheat taste with an overtone of banana and light cloves.  A light floral hop bitterness balances well in the finish.  Worth searching out if you are a fan of the style.
Great beer, enjoy it very much. Must be drank in the appropriate glass though. Aroma is not much to rave about but the flavor definitely makes up for it.

Bottle [660ml] shared with garthicus & HogTownHarry -- c/o HogTownHarry. Dec. 13, 2011. Pours a cloudy orange-amber with a small diminishing frothy off-white head. Aroma of lightly sour fruit, sweet caramel malt, yeast and light spices. Flavour of caramel malt, light spices, fruit (banana and more) and wheat. Alcohol well hidden. Average bodied. Pretty good, an enjoyable version of the style.

Hazy orange-yellow with small white head.  Aroma lemons and oranges and grains.  Medium-full body, some carbonation, some alcohol although mostly hidden.  Wheat and citrus flavors, a little sweet and syrupy, a little banana-like ester background.  Enjoyable.  Not clear that this should really be a style but if it is might as well be this one.

Cloudy appearance. Copper in color. Frothy off-white head that descipates quickly. Poor lacing. Smells like warm Caramel corn. There is definite vanilla and bananas in the aroma. It taste like banana cream pie. It starts out sweet and finishes very creamy. Medium carbonation. This was a very good beer and would definitely have again.
on tap. Too hoppy for the style. It is also astringent and alcoholic with awkward malt notes. Stick to Vitus.

pours a very cloudy orange with very little head an no lacing.aromas of ripe bananas and yeast and malt.yeast is giving off some basements aromas.flavour is banana,wheat and a little orange zest and has a very boozey dry finish.this is very nice for its price range.

Poured into a shaker glass from a 22ounce bottle with no freshness date.

A: Hazy amber orange with only a very thin white head with little retention. Boring looking.

S: Very sweet fruity aroma, overripe bananas mostly. Smells okay, but very sweet. 

T: Wheat flavors up front quickly into a very sweetness I cant describe that then turns into an overripe banana flavor and ends with a slight amount of alcohol. 

M: Thick and syrupy with little carbonation. 

O: I think this bottle is a bit old but its a bit too sweet and syrupy for my liking.
Bomber.  Pours orangey amber with a large white head.  Aroma and flavor are candied banana, some bubble gum, some tropical fruit.  Low bitterness, very boozy.  Palate seems on the thin side.

Pours to a hazy light chestnut wood colored body with a mostly dissipating off-white head.  Aroma is very wheat laden and has a nice clove, banana, and wheat sprouts.  Flavors are much the same.  The palate comes through as sweet, but not over done.  Moderate body with a creamy satin texture.  Notes of mineral water.  Alcohol is well hidden.  A pretty decent beer @ $5 a bomber.

Sweet, floral aroma with an undercurrent of yeast.  The taste is plenty impressive - a dollop of fruity sweetness encased in bready hop sandwich.  There is a little yeasty bite in the finish and warming on the palate.  Very well done.
750 ml.  pours a hazy golden color with a nice white head.  Aromas of banana, yeast, and earth.  Light bodied but fullof flavor for this style, a nice beer

Bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy yeasty wheat malty aroma. Sweetish wheat malty spicy yeasty dark fruit flavor with hints of banana. Has a sweetish wheat malty spicy yeasty caramel finish.

On tap at the mad mex robinson.  Very nice look. Just like a hefe should look, hazy and almost orange. Nice creamy head.  Mellow hefe aroma. A little strong initially on the taste buds for a hefe. I expect that tho, because after all it is a lag and lag is usually over the top. Some decent co2 in there. HAs a little of that banana in there too. Medicnal finish. I like hefes but this is more than a hefe.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: This poured a very murky medium to dark orange color with a biege head. Aromawas lots of yeast, banana, and some citrus.  Flavor was citrusy, oughy, spices and banana. A very nice weizenbock.

22oz bomber split with Anndiesel.  Unfiltered glowing orange.  Thin, steady white head.  Big yeasty banana aroma, quite nice in that regard.  The big yeasty tones are really pronounced and luscious, and the quality ingredients shine.  However, it sort of lacks balance and refinement, a little boozy.  The sharply soapy and bitter hops arent really pleasant at all.  A solid toasty, clean, sugary malt backbone.  OK.

22 oz bottle to put me (back?) into the top 5 of Lagunitas raters.  22 oz bottle poured into a BIG glass.  Hazy orange with off-white head.  Nose sweet mid-fruitiness, candy sugar, and yeast.  Taste is big sweet yeastiness, light tart smack follows.  Not picking up much of the 9% abv.  Bubble gum out back.  High citrus and raisin/light brown sugar.  Now Im getting the alcohol.

" & We Way-Overfed It" and then some....damn.   A mighty tasty assault on the senses.  Um, there is banana and clove flavor...hahaha.  IDDoppel...how many letters can you add in front to point out they had fun with this one.  Two good beers, in one glass.  Some dodgy bar owner could cut this 50% with water.  Moving on, tasty yeast, mighty tasty yeast and that is the important part...they gave it some tasty food and got a tasty beverage.  Lagunitas is awesome.

This one was too much of a good thing.  I like a hefeweizen and I like a good doppel weizen but this was just so intensely spicy/bananaish that it was bordering on unpleasant to drink.  Didnt want more then a small sample.

Aroma is pronounced banana with lighter pineapple character,  Pours a hazy yellow orange with a thicj white pillowy head.  Taste is sweet and phenolic, almost oppressively so.  Very sticky, oily and heavy.  Some bitterness at end.  I see that this rated highly but It seems quite out of balance to me.  Nice in a very small aliquot but cant drink a full hefeweizen glass worth.
Just popped this beer. This tastes just a smoked beer.                       Or bananas.....

Tap at The Pony Bar, NYC. Pours cloudy gold with a tight, pure white cream cap. Aroma is quite lovely, with a very pronounced, forward wheat and yeast character, then some caramel and candi and bread just beyond. Flavor is heavy, with slightly syrupy and strong sweetness, caramel, toasted sugar, wheat, and dough. Full bodied with average to lively carbonation. Fairly warm on the finish, dense sugar, thick and rich bread, wheat and yeast, light grassy bitterness. Its a pretty hefty beer, and pretty good, too.

golden pour with a light head.  sweet with a taste of bananas and slightly bready.  i really liked this one.  hopefully lagunitas doesnt limit it too much.  this may be the best american Weizen ive tasted.  surprise find at the Giant grocery store.

I bought a single 22oz bottle of this from Woodmans in Janesville, WI for $4.39 in late 2011. 

Pours a cloudy golden amber color with a slight fluffy head. Scents are very floral with hibiscus, banana, and yeasty tones. Taste is smooth and flavorful. It has a wheat and slightly bitter taste with some flavors of biscuits. Quite fulfilling and tasty. Definitely a must try, especially since its a limited release.
Hearty looking golden body topped with a  pillowy head.  Sweet bread with heavy grain.  A little spice, banana, some light citrus.  Nice.

Bottle.  Interesting pour, much lighter than I guess I thought I expected, golden amber.  Quite active and bubbly, with a nice head.  Classical weizen aroma -- yeast and banana.  This drinks quite smoothly, with not a bit of 9% at all evident here.  This drinks like a pedestrian weizen, but has a kick-ass, full body.  (#4447, 1/15/2012)

Poured into a weizen glass from a 22oz bottle.
A:citrus, banana, bread, 
A:cloudy, sparkling, orange, minimal white head, 
T:medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 
This is a great drinking beer that I enjoyed very much. A very good go-to-beer when craving a Doppel Weizen.

(22oz bottle) Purchased from Vintage Liquors (Rialto Hotel) in Victoria, BC, for $7.95. Pours headless with a clouded amber hue. Nose is sweet (cotton candy), oily and somewhat hopped. Good mouthfeel - alcoholic orange Tang with a bourbon chaser. A good burn through the finish. All in all very revitalizing.
Fresh hop aroma with a thin white head and lace. Copper/orange colour. Low carbonation. Orange citrus aroma. Tangy zesty notes with banana. Oily , slick texture. Whisky barrel finish.

22 oz bottle. Pours a murky orange/gold with a thin white cap and a steady stream of bubbles working their way north.  Rich aroma full of wheat, banana, clove, brown sugar and orange peel.  Flavor is full of wheat notes with the banana again. Think banana  bread, made with wheat flour, drizzled with caramel. Full, smooth palate. This was wonderful. This is a style I really enjoy, but usually forget to look for.

Densely clouded orangey amber hue, thick pillowy head formation. Strong clove and banana aroma along with some citrus and tropical orange fruit. Palate is big for a wheat, clove and bubblegum upfront followed by a syrupy warm alcohol middle and a heavy  citrus in the finish. Not a style I regularly drink but hops and alcohol make a good bastardization of the style.

Picked this bottle up at the Kensington Wine Market in Calgary, Pours a hazy golden amber with a thin dissapating head. Nose of rich sweet malt and clove.  flavour: spice, clove, banana & orange peel. Medimum boddied with a slight bitter finish. This is a tasty, enjoyable beer

8 jan 2012, bottle. Light orange, clear, some steady bubbles. Very yeasty banana. Med body and a bit fizzy. Tastes pretty good. Just like a German weizen. It is a spiced banana weizen. Heavy on the spiced. Nice.

Bottle pours slightly hazy copper with gold edges and thin white head. The aroma is full of banana and spicy yeast notes along with lesser amounts of grainy malts and sweet apple. The taste moves in with a nice creamy mouth feel creating firm notes of red apple, some sweet cherry and then growing banana and spicy yeastiness. It gains a bit of grainy malts before the sweet and lagery banana and apple notes take it into the finish. I get no sense of the sizeable ABV.

Bottle.  Banana, clove, wheat malt and astringent alcohol aroma.   Hazy golden yellow color with moderate head.   Sweet banana, clove, wheat malt flavor.  Strong bitter herbal/alcohol finish - very intense with larger tastes.  Nice - a bit boozy but spot-on style-wise.
A cloudy orange beer with a small white head.  The aroma is wheat, yeast, and lemon.  The flavor is wheat, yeast, and slightly floral.  Pretty good, but not exceptional.

From the bomber. Hazy dark gold pour with a thin white head. Banana, bubblegum nose with hints of wheat. Taste shows a slightly thicker wheat body with more notes of the bubblegum and banana coming, but more subtle. Smooth easy drinking brew.

Bomber. Hazy gold with a small white head. Sweet fruity aroma with banana and bubble gum. Sweet banana flavor and a healthy dose of alcohol. Lighter in body, which makes it more belgian than bock to me. A nice stab at a simple yet amped up weizenbock but could use some work.

Aroma of sourdough, peach, and a hint of iron.  Pours hazy orange with a medium head.  Taste of sourdough bread, clove, and light fruits.  Good strong floral taste throughout.  Cool brew and bigger than anything like it.

22oz bomber. Pours a hazy orange with a thin white head.  Aroma of banana, clove, slight alcohol.  Medium-full bodied on the tongue, with initial crash of banana/clove flavors and finishing with a mild alcohol bite and lingering spicy flavors.

Golden tan body with almost no cap, just a sad bubble ring around the edge of the glass. Aroma is a good but not good. It has an odd but pleasant rubbing alcohol, orange peel maybe lemon, hints of caramel, some wheat type malts, and caramel. Taste is the same but better. Mouth feel seems thin and thats all I have to say about that. Brew reminds me of a Belgian strong more than any German beer. Apple, wood, yeast, wheat, hints of banana. Good drinking beer, goes down smooth and easy but still has a kick. I LIKE IT!!!

Pours a hazy dark yellow amber with a cream colored head. Nose is bananas, cloves, and bread.  Sweet flavor of banana, cloves, and orange peels.  Rich, creamy, big bodied beer with pretty strong flavors, all of which go well together.  Really good and Ill drink this again.

Bottle, shared with Parksy. Very hazy bright light orange with a thick creamy mousse of a head that retains beautifully. Aroma is very estery and spicy. Flavours are nice banana, heaps of spice, hints of bubblegum; sweet with a warming finish. Nice job Lagunitas for brewing something other than a hop monster (although I do love your hop monsters!).
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Deep yellow-gold pour with a little bit of a tight white head. The aroma is a blend of soft wheat and a little bit of banana in addition to some light apple and a bit of dried orange sweetness. A sort of candied fruit character along with a little bit of marzipan. Rich sweet malt with a touch of lingering peppery character. Some toasted sweet malt. Its okay but not great.

22 ounce bottle.  Serves in a weizen glass, the beer pours a slightly hazy golden/orange color with about an inch and a half off-white head.  Head retention is good, but there isnt much lacing left on the glass.  The brew smells like cloves, bananas, wheat, and a little bit of orange peel.  The brew tastes like cloves, sweet spices (maybe allspice?), wheat/bready malt, bananas, orange and orange peel, and some bubblegum.  Mouthfeel/body is medium, with a moderate amount of carbonation.  I think its a decent overall brew, but theres nothing thats memorable about it.  Not bad for $4.99 a bottle, for that price its certainly worth a try.

(22 oz bottle from Jasons) Pours cloudy golden/light amber. Tall off-white head. Aroma of yeast, fruit, clove, banana, booziness, pepper, caramel. Mouthfeel wheaty-smooth and full. Lots of broken, droopy lacing. Flavor is sweet and boozy with some banana. Brown sugar, fruit, yeast. Peppery in the finish. Very nice, tasty weizen bock. Always glad to come across a well-made beer in this style.

very cloudy tea color with tight bubbly head.  Nose of bubblegum, banana, light malt.  Alcohol is completely subsumed by the olfactory and gustatory characteristics. Enough spice and hoppiness in flavor to compete with the sugary side of things.  True to style and a fine beer all around.
Citrus nose, nice sweetness but with a bit of hoppy character youd expect from lagunitas. Sweet fruity finish. Reminds me of a sweeter version of their copper ale. Very nice!

A rich orange with a huge puffy head. Alcohol and fake banana flavouring on the nose with some fat and toasty cereals.  Definitely strong, not what I wanted or was expecting.  Its just too strong.  It could be a beautiful and drinkable weizen but the alcohol hangs over it in a dominating fashion.   Its genuinely an unpleasant surprise to have this beer (which comes in a 22) smack you in the face when you take what you expect to be a long and delicious draught.  Its so hot that it makes the fruity nature of the yeast taste moldy.  I just cant agree with this one.

Slightly cloudy orange colour. aromas of belgian yeasts and big oily note as well. has a less flavour and butterscoth and syrup note. nutty and grains.
Another great brew from one of my favorite breweries.

This poured a clear golden orange body, lively with carbonation, and capped by a three-fingered head that settles down into a modest creamy covering.  It had an aroma of fresh bread, banana slices, and a light spiciness.  The banana was stronger in the flavor and there was a hit of alcohol in the back of the throat that seemed somewhaht out of place.  It finished dry with an orange rind bitterness.  Interesting.

Name: Our Own Doppel Weizen
Date: October 02, 2011
Mode: Bottle
Source: Hop City, Atlanta
Appearance: hazy orange, fine off white head
Aroma: sweet malt aroma, sweet banana, light clove
Flavor: sweet malt flavor, candy sweetness, touch of banana, balancing spicy clove, light bitterness
Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 6/10; Flavor: 6/10; Palate: 6/10; Overall: 12/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 8/10
Score: ** /4

Hazy golden orange with a good sized off-white head. Aroma is of caramel, light banana, butterscotch, toffee, and light apricot. Taste is of alcohol, light banana, slightly floral, refreshing and warming at the same time.
Slighty cloudy, turning bright, lacing white head. Smell is banana cream pie, sweet, marshmallow, and yeast. The taste is yeast, not as fruity, clove, wheat, and some back sweetness

Almost liquid banana.  Banana aroma, mouthfeel consistency, and in the taste.  That and the cloves are not my favourites, and were counter to a style I like a lot better. The mouthfeel is above average.  Dark brown bodied. Better after spicey food.

On tap for growler fills at Half Time.  Pours a hazy gold with a large creamy white head. Light musk on the nose which gains prominence as it warms.  Wheat, toast, and sweetness.  Nice.  Medium bodied, smooth and full of wheat with touches of banana.  Nice banana bread notes, wheat.  Smooth and estery.

Strong banana nose, a touch of feet and ketchup. Fairly clear amber, thin head. Banana and peaches, whole lemon toward the end. Brief appearance of  vanilla creme. Finishes unwelcomingly bitter with lemongrass. This isnt Lagunitas idiom, and it shows.It has the strength and characteristics of a very good weizenbock. OTOH, the hopping is weird and there is an acetic flaw. Needs a tweak, but there is real potential.

Aromas of pear/banana, some caramel, and a slight smokiness in there. Pours golden and cloudy. Head is ample, and fades quickly. Wonderful sweet and caramel flavor, a bit of sourness too. Nice, full, creamy mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Finishes nicely, very long. Overall, a very interesting beer
It reminds me of eating Wheaties. Not my favorite style of beer. But it was easy to drink. I was surprised with the alcohol percentage at 9%.
A cloudy, headless beer that is nice on the nose. Floral with the slightest hint of banana. Pairs well with light foods and cheese like goat and blue. Enjoyable any time of year.

Unclear yellow orange, decent off white head. Wheaty yeasty aroma. Initial taste is strong alcohol on the tongue, cloying Belgium yeast, giving way to wheat, banana, spices and alcohol. Alcohol like finish. Did I mention theres a lot of alcohol in this brew? NFL (Not For Lagerboys)

Pours a hazy amber with a 2 finger, creamy eggshell head. Aroma is sharp banana, citrus, sweet wheat, floral hops and a sour planty note that I cant really pin down, oh and a big, boozy punch. Flavor is sweet wheat, orange peel (I think its probably got actual orange peel in it), lots of hot booze, citrus (maybe hops, maybe fruit), lots and lots of sweet malt, corn tortillas, leafy, spicy hops and sour grapes to the finish. Palate is pretty heavy, sticky and slick throughout with a light, but very sharp carbonation. Not the worst thing ever, but way to hot and boozy, sticky and sweet. Makes me think of orange marmalade, which isnt bad.

22oz bottle: Pours a slightly cloudy bright golden brass with a spotty-lacing white head.  Has a sweet wheaty nose with some banana esters and orange zest.  Starts with pretty good fullness and malty sweetness with doughy yeasty notes and a smooth bitter hop balance before a slightly warming peppery clove finish.  Pretty true to style, but could hide the alcohol a little better.

Hazy dull straw color with decent offwhite head.  Floral bubblegum nose.  Sweet wheaty character with some faint lemon citrus hints but moreso vanilla, and honeysuckle and slightly phenolic, but not offensively so.  Pretty damn tasty, but too sweet for my personal tastes.

Tap at Grumpys northeast. Pours a hazy orangeish yellow with a white head. Aroma banana esters, slight clove presence and bubblegum. Mind of grainy too. Tastes of bananas upfront with cloves and gum behind it. Not nearly as much bubblegum presence on tap as in the bottle a few months ago. More well rounded and soft overall. Alcohol is completely masked. Not a great Weizenbock, but good for being off tr beaten path for lagunitas.

Bottle thanks to 17thfloor for sharing. Pours a hazy bright golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is plenty citric and spicy with clove and banana notes, hops are fairly up front with the wheat. Flavor starts sweet and citric, slowly picking up spicy notes before a hop forward finish, fruity citric and some wheat note that linger. Medium body and a crisp carbonation. Decent, a bit heavy on the hops but refreshing.....oh just picked up on some booziness in the finish.

UPDATED: SEP 10, 2016 Good Stuff. Strong banana aroma. Cloudy dark orange color. Some booze warmth in the flavor in the middle with some more pronounced hops ending the taste. Occasionally the hops were a bit to strong. Serving: Bottle

Medium orange, nice head, slight haze.  Looks rather like the label.  Aroma is wheat, slight clove, and banana.  Flavor is a match - the focus is definitely more on the wheaty malts than the yeast, although there is a slightly off phenolic note that is a bit rubbery.  This is really only apparent while the beer was cold, it wasnt there as it warmed.  A really nice beer, good to see Lagunitas show their chops at something that isnt a hop bomb.  Good stuff, would definitely go back to this one.
(bottle) Murky orage-straw body with a big white head. Aroma of yeast, just a little spice, vanilla, banana, and caramel malt; alcohol is noticeable, and hops in the finish. Soft, full body.

Phone rate. 22oz bottle, no date. $5.49 at KnB. Hazy orange yellow with a one finger light beige head, creamy with good retention. Big banana in the nose with some toasty malts, mod sweetness.  Flavor has a good amount of banana and some vanilla, some spicy alcohol keeping that and the lightly toasted malt and granular caramel sauce. Never got too sweet, surprisingly.wheaty finish with some alcohol, bitterness peaked at a 2 1/2. Full body with medium carb--kinda smooth and prickly at the same time. Pretty tasty, and, as always with Lagunitas, priced to sell.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: A bit less than I was expecting, but not bad, tastes like a hefe but with a nice wheat presence and can taste the belgian yeast as well, a little hoppy and bitter, taste some citrus going down as well.  All in all not bad but could have been more.

Another stellar brew from Lagunitas. Has the classic Lagunitas flavor. Big on the malts on this one that are very crisp and citrisy. The mouthfeel is very nice and goes down with a bit of taste to it that lingers nicely in the mouth. GREAT BREW

Poured from growler into a Carlsburg Weizen glass. Murky straw with about a finger of white head. Honey, straw, wheat and yeast make up the aroma. A little bit of booze, more bitter than a normal weizen, I guess thats the bock speaking up. Crisp and clean, very drinkable. Just a bit of an aftertaste. Very satisfying, but not an extraordinary weizen.

Thanks to HogTownHarry. Appearance: Cloudy yellow, medium thickness snow white head. Aroma: Delicious yeast, mildly spicy, banana, earthy, fruit skin. Flavour: Slight alcohol, tangy malt, spicy, quite a whack of yeast, raisins & long yeasty alcoholic finish with a hint of banana. Nice. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bomber shared with blankboy and garthicus.  Hazy orange-amber, smallish off-white head.  Smells great - earthy, sweet fruit malt, herbal, some alcohol, not over-hopped.  Taste follows, a little stronger, grassy, but still banana and earthiness dominate - average body, weak carbonation, medium-quick finish, a little dry and gritty in the aftertaste.  Hard to believe this is Lagunitas - not over-hopped, quite close to on-style .... quite warming.

Aromas of pear/banana, some caramel, and a slight smokiness in there. Maybe a phenol/acetone character to it (but not unpleasantly so), although my wife and I argued a bit on that.  Pours golden and cloudy.  Head is ample, and fades quickly.  Wonderful sweet and caramel flavor, a bit of sourness too.  Nice, full, creamy mouthfeel.  Medium carbonation.  Finishes nicely, very long.  Overall, a very interesting beer and one of my favorites in this category.

Hazy golden pour with a quickly fading white head.  Aroma is huge banana and clove and a touch of underlying sweetness.  Smells like a hefeweizen as I do not get much alcohol or heavy malt character on the aroma.  Taste follows the aroma with banana and clove up front before some malt sweetness and alcohol.  Feels slick and a bit stick in the mouth.  I like this beer but I think it could have been better if the ABV was closer to 6 or 7% as I think the extra malt and booze take away from an otherwise great beer.
Nice golden color, thick foamy head with lacing that sticks around. Syrupy, yeasty, boozy but still very drinkable. Bomber for under $5 is a great value.

Hazed yellow/gold, thick white head. Aroma of clove, yeast, fruit, some funk. Taste has oranges, yeast funk, some medicinal qualities, buttery. Not bad, but this iodine/band-aid thing is throwing me off.

Bottle from SL. Pour was a full hazy golden with a tint of orange. Big huge white colored head and decent lacing. Aroma of cloves and strong bananas, some bread. Flavor was unfortunately cloying by way of the banana stickiness and excessive phenolic and clovey products. Even the yeast became annoying and this was plenty effort to finish, despite normally liking this kind of stye and this kind of brewer. Mouthfeel was full but sticky and cloying itself. Ah well.

Smells like a weizen on the nose with sweet banana undertones.  This beer has a magnificent golden brown colour, which just says drink me.  Fine bead and quite soft on the palate this beer has good length of flavours.  Slightly too sweet for my palate, but a mighty fine beer.  Also just noticed this beer is 9%.  Lucky for me I found it to be too sweet as I would be chugging this beer back with gay abandon!

UPDATED: DEC 21, 2011 Cloudy orange pour,frothy short head.
Aroma of big bannana,sweet,bready,fruit,little spice touch of citrus.Smells nice.
Nice orange like wheat beershort initial sweetness followed by,grassy citrusy,strong tasting,clean bitter bold finish.Slick kind of alcoholy tasting.Lots of orange citrus bitter lingering.Maybe some toastyness towards the end

More in the direction of Vitus than Aventinus, this one pours a shade or two darker than a traditional weizen, plenty of haze, and large off-white head. Boozy nose with mixed fruit, banana, and bready notes. Palate offers big flavors of bread/wheat cracker, some banana clove, and juicy fruits in the background. A little boozy on the palate. Finishes with some heat as well. Suffers in drinkability, but unfortunately thats no longer a reviewing criterion.

Aroma of bananas and sweet spice.  Pours a cloudy orange.  Taste is sweet with tones of orange and spice.  Next there is a slight taste of hoppy bitterness and wheat. Finally leaving behind a lingering flavor of caramel.

650 ml bottle. Trade with Coldbrewky. Thanks a lot Steve!
Hazy amber colour with big white head. 
Fruity sweetness, banana, caramel, wheat, mild yeast and mild alcohol in aroma. Sweet caramel, ripe banana, some alcohol, wheat, mild yeast and mild bitterness. Quite sweet and heavy Doppelweizen. Very enjoyable though.
Hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma of yeast, lemon, wheat and clove. Taste medium sweetness, lightly sour, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish.
Cloudy amber color. Medium head. Full body. Rich spicy yeast flavor. Some alcohol in taste.

Pours a hazy orange with a bubbly white head. Nose is sweet banana, clove and caramel malt. Sweet malt a front runner in this but the phenolics and spice provide great balance and complexity. Pretty tasty beer.

Poured a light copper with little to no head or lacing.  Aroma of bubblegum, clove & banana.  Medium mouthfeel.  Sweeter than I expected, a bit boozy with banana, clove and some barnyard.  Very drinkable.  Almost reminded me of a Triple.  Nice brew.

Pours a burnt orange with white head. Aroma of banana bread, raisin, cloves and hint of cinnamon. Taste is intense almost cloyingly sweet. Flavors of cloves, bananas, floral notes, yeast, bubblegum, honey and some barnyard on the finish. A solid brew with balance.

22 oz. bottle, consumed on 12-3-11. Very strong, sweet, floral, and yeasty aroma features bubblegum, banana, baking bread, clove, and cinnamon scents. Even a little bit of milk chocolate and caramel. On the verge of cloying, but otherwise I really like it. Pours a cloudy, apricot-colored relatively light gold. Highly effervescent; long-lasting, champagne-like bubbling. Large amount of thick, long-lasting, cream-colored head. Produces extensive, intricate, web-like lacing. One of the most appealing-looking beers Ive seen in awhile. Very sweet, spicy, and boozy taste, like spicy syrup. Alcohol highly noticeable. Yeasty, doughy, and milky tastes. Prune, orange citrus, and condensed milk flavors. Over-the-top. Dull, pruny, lightly bitter aftertaste. Medium body. Frothy, oily, sharp, and lively in the palate. Lagunitas Our Own Bavarian-Style Doppel Weizen is a very, very interesting, unique, powerful, and memorable beer. Its not perfect, but it is quite entertaining, and Im not going to forget it any time soon.

The aroma is banana, bubble gum, clove.  The appearance is hazy yellow/amber, white head.  The flavor is banana, clove.  Less sweet than aroma.  The finish is clove, spicy, pine hops.  Medium in body.  Well done.
I like boozy beers, but this one was like a decent Weiss beer mixed with a shot of isopropyl alcohol.  No gusta.

22oz bottle poured into a stein glass. A very strong banana and clove aroma.  Has a cloudy butterscotch appearance. This is a  prefectly favored wheat beer.  We hardly noticed the high alcohol notes. Went very well with Thai food.

Hazy, rich orange colored beer with a fluffy, white head. Strong aromas of citrus, caramel, and some spices. Taste is a delicious mixture of caramel, oranges, bananas, and sweet dough. Throw in some subtle hints of peppery spices and you have a great tasting beer. A wheat beer on steroids, although the ABV is well hidden. Lingering sweet, fruity finish. Very good, a must try.

A great American example of one of my favorite German styles.  Bananas, cloves, citrus nose.  Light orange, cloudy, sparse lacing.  Big clove taste, along with ripe bananas and some apricot. No booze detected.  Really awesome, thanks for sharing Ron!

The pour is a hazy dark orange with an average sized off-whit head. The aroma has light banana, some spice and yeasty bread aromas. The flavor starts a bit harsh and mellows out on the next swallows. The light sweetness is balanced with a light hop bitterness. The alcohol is apparent and detracts somewhat.

650ml bottle. Pours a very cloudy (opaque) light orange/rust colour with nearly white head that dissipates quickly but leaves a little lace. Smells like.....frying bacon! Theres a lot of spice and citrus notes in there as well. Quite citrusy on the palate with a nice spicy hit. The booze comes on in the finish and mingles with spice in a way thats not entirely pleasant.

Bomber from Sams, Durham. Semi-cloudy bronze pour with a big fluffy head that lingers a while. Nose is quite potent, and if youre not in the mood for an ester bomb, this one will come in quite low Id imagine. But for some reason I had that particular flavor on the brain and was thus quite satisfied by this proudly one-dimensional beer. Light fruit and a dash of dry hops in the finish, along with some caramel and a dash of herbs. Interesting brew. One minute I think its a well realized traditional WB, the next I think its an enjoyably "arrogant" variation on the style. I dug it either way.

Bomber.  Poured hazy medium orange with a dense off-white head.  The aroma picked up warm, toasted banana and bready notes with some peppery spice and cloves around.. the sugars masked the boozage well.  The flavor found dry, tangy wheat and peppery alcohol on the tip of the tongue, with grainy banana and vanilla sugars following.. tangy again on the finish, with orange and floral notes joining.. well-balanced and tasty.  Medium-bodied, spicy, and grainy on the palate.. I enjoyed it.

750 from Decicco.  Golden honey colored with flat head.  Nailed the banana clove aroma plus a little heat.  Nice sweet fruity honey peach with slightly cloying peach syrup and yeasty mildly assertive hot finish.  The flavor is excellent.  Lacks the subtle palate and fluffiness of a well...Vitus...for example. It still feels like a strong beer, which some people might like in the still, I guess.  But not me.   Nonetheless, very good.

Pours a hazy dark golden orange with tangerine hues and a two finger off-white head that very slowly fades into a thick lasting ring. 

Complex aroma with a nice balance of zesty spice, light fruit, citrus rind and bready yeast. Theres a peppery clove presence that is countered by hints of banana, orange peel, bread and chocolate. 

Full bodied with a nice creamy texture and a blast of zesty spice up front that lingers over the sweet fruit and yeast notes into a tart, dry finish. Lots of peppery clove followed by a prominent bready yeast character that gives fullness to the palate. This is followed by faint banana and malt sweetness before the citrus fruit kicks in. Lots of zesty orange and lemon peel rounding which in addition to providing sweetness, is a nice compliment to the heavy spice character. The ABV is excellently masked with no heat to speak of but there is a lot going on here and its very full bodied making it a bit of a sipper. 

Overall this beer was a success. Usually Im not into American Imperial versions of German styles but this beer is well balanced and really tasty. Its a bit heavy handed but they managed to capture some great flavors that are characteristic of the style. Nice job Lagunitas!

Pours a hazy, amber color with an off-white head.  Aroma is of caramel malts, banana, dark fruits, and some alcohol.  Flavor is sweet from the dark fruits and caramel malts up front.  Banana and yeast on the finish with a slight alcohol warming.  Pretty good.

Hazy deep golden amber with a nice white head... quite yeasty clovey aroma, very spicy, a little herbal... flavor profile matches, very spicy, moderately full bodied, dry finish, a light sweetness towards the end... nice beer but not my favorite, with bigger alcohol i like more depth...

Orange-amber with lace. Lemon and sweet orange aroma, with clove and wheat. Very sweet flavor, with orange, lightest banana, clove. Strong alcohol, with a silky, oily body. Packs a big punch but is a bit unrefined.

750ml bottle. Rating #217. Extremely cloudy orangish brown color with a xmall white head. Big fruity nose, banana and pear were very prominent. Sweet yeasty flavor, more banana and a surgary quality. Pretty tasty. (2021)

text: Bomber from the Bayou shared with Mike. Pours a murky dark copper color with a medium white head. The aroma is sweet bananas and spices, some caramel and fruit. The flavor is a rich authentic and clean Bock with loads of heft and flavor; banana, caramel, dry yeast, some sweeter fruits like ripe apples. Quite nice.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2012 Draft at Rattle n Hum with STreets and Baron. Pours a hazy golden amber body with thin, but creamy off white lacing. Aroma is sweet bready notes, wheat and yeast. Mouthfeel is creamy with notes of sweet fruity malts, bread, and yeast. I wasnt really feeling this guy.

Slightly hazy golden coloured body with a thinnish off-white head. Aroma of alcohol, cloves, yeast, wheat and a bit of curacao. Medium to Full-bodied; Strong assertive alcohol and yeast flavours with a lot of wheat, some minor coriander seed notes, some dry herbal tastes and not much else - just a punch of alcohol. Overall, an okay beer - but a bit strong for a weizen bock, and showing only the harsher sides of the style and not enough sweetness and complexity. I sampled this 65 cL bottle purchased earlier in the day from K&E Discount Beverage in New Paltz, New York on 26-November-2011 sampled here in New Paltz later in the day, for US$4.99.

Bottle @ Exira Beer Summit II, courtesy of gooovikings. Glowing peach orange, cloudy appearance with a white head. Huge banana brea, moderate clove, somewhat spicy yeasty aroma. Flavor is a lot of the same- huge banana, moderate clove, quite spicy yeasty, wheat malty flavor. Banana bomb.

22 oz. bottle from P.C.C. No, I dont want to buy into your stupid co-op to get a discount! Damn, youd figure my patronage would be sufficient to get the deals. Well, this has a hazy orange body, with no head to speak of. Looks decent. Fairly nuanced - aroma wise. This has a nice banana, yeast, bubblegum, sugar, dough, and wheat aroma. Its quite pungent, so needless to say, Im diggin this beer. Flavor is mildly spicy, at first, but then comes a sweet yeast, sugar, dough, and banana flavor. Cloudy yellow/gold color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of sweet malt, yeast, clove, fruit, & spice; Flavor of sweet malt, yeast, ripe bananas, clove, hops, and some citrus; Finish is slightly bitter; Nicely balanced; On the sweet side - but pretty good overall.

Tap. Hazy straw yellow with a thin white head. Lots of banana and citrus with some hay and sweetness. Flavor has lots of banan, slight fruit sweetness, slight citrus. Medium body with soft carbonation. Solid

To addend my rating, I had no hint of banana after reading other ratings after doing my own (never preread for bias). Then I put a slightly overly ripe banana to the nose, then compared. Sweet fruity malt aroma. Cloudy orange color with a small white head. Moderate sweet beginning that fades to a very mild bitter finish

22 oz. bottle from Randalls. Pours a cloudy orange-gold with a small eggshell white head. Aroma of weizen yeast- banana, sugar, tropical fruits, sweet bread, and caramel malts. Flavor of banana bread, toffee, toasted sugar, apricot, citrus, and graham crackers. Medium body with moderate carbonation and a sticky sweet mouthfeel. Not bad but not my thing.
Excellent beer to enjoy with my Thanksgiving dinner.  Taste is baking spices, bread and booze.  Smooth and very enjoyable.
22oz bottlepours a rich light tan head with hazy gold color.  Aroma is bready-light/medium malt, banana, hint of spice.  Taste is spice hops, sweet/bready-light/medium malt, banana.
Strong beer, has a nice soft feel but with a spicy fizziness, the malt bring the banana like taste with a strong punch at the end. Would go good with German and spicy dishes. Enjoy

orange pour with a thin to medium white head.
aroma is banana and spice. some caramel maltiness. 
flavour is both initially sweet malt, hint of sticky alc, transitioning to a slightly metallic sourness towards the finish. Hints of wheat and spice linger.
Rating from notes. On draft at hop angel. Nice fruity, banana aroma and flavor. Good one for summertime.

Tap at Old Chicago in Apple Valley, MN. Bright hazy orange pour with a clingy white head. Nose of banana and clove. Medium smooth palate. Taste is clove, banana, fruity esters.....really nice.
A different beer from Lagunitas. Nice orange apperance and has taste of wheat and spices. A solid, drinkable brew.

The taste is much the smell with a fine moderate bubbly sparkle. There is a slight caramel taste with a bready wheat fullness and a grain bitterness that lets me know it?s higher alc. Clove, bittering orange citrus and subtle banana dominate behind the grain, with some slightly earthy herbal hop dryness that dries close to a pale ale. There is not a ton going on but it feels full and works out as a complete beer. Alright for an american wheat bock. Id like to see more attempts at this style.

Light and hazy.  Straw on the sides, darker orange in the middle.  Nice looking thick head on top.  Clove is apparent in the aroma.  Light spicy esters. As it warms that banana flavor definitely increases.  The spice remains and the depth increases.  Creamy dense palate.  Still could use more malt character, but nice nonetheless.
From a bottle poured an orangish color with almost no head.  Strong sweet malty flavor with a lasting finish.

Cloudy golden orange in color... Aroma is wheat malts and notes of cloves and banana... Flavor is full of wheat, banana and sweetness and finishes moderately bitter of hops.... Decent beer, but nothing memorable, feel like Ive had plenty like it and many better German varieties...
super bananas and cloves, big, rich, wheaty, full-bodied, head and lacing good and persistent, sweet even cloying, dark amber - big.OVERALL: Memorable.

Cloudy amber orange color almost no head just a very light ring of white head ...  aroma of caramel malt, banana and light clove, fruity belgian yeast and light wheat .... tastes of wheat, caramel malts, fruity yeast, banana light clove and a little bready with a slight spicy bite that lingers into the finish .... the abv is hidden real well ... nice solid brew
