Pour is a nice shade of orangey gold, with nearly no head and just a small white ring around the edge. The nose is of fruit for the most part. The taste is a nice balance of fruity hops, and a spicy belgian yeast.

On tap at Bangers & Lace. Pours hazy dark gold. Aroma is typical wheat bear with a little bit of hops. Flavor is initially pretty solid wheat beer with medium body (for the style). Finish is a bit hoppy and bitter with a mild maltiness. A little too much bitterness for my liking.

Pours a cloudy gold with little head but a lot of carbonation still in the body of the beer.  Strong, sweet banana aroma but not in a bad way.  Light on the palate.  Sweet upfront (not overly so) and a bit bitter on the back end, so nice balance.  Definitely has a good yeasty profile and the banana comes through as well.  Very good beer

Pours amber orange with an off-white soapy head.  The aroma has heavy estery ripe banana, lots of peppery spice, brown sugar and hints of plastic.  Medium / full body thats very lush and has semi-sharp carbonation that unobtrusive.  The flavor starts with a ton of pepper, plastic, rich wheat, banana, syrup and mild caramel.  The finish has lots of brown sugar, spice and alcohol.  Nice beer, but best in moderation with the heavy sweetness.

Poured from bottle a golden blond with small white head.  Aromas is sugary banana, with a dose of caramel.  Flavor is bready, malty and has notes of overipe bananas, caramel, a little clove, and then moves toward some tartness at the end.  Palate is lightly acidic with good carbonation, sticky and thick, mostly sweet and lightly tart.  I liked it, but makes me want a lighter version where the flavor over powers the sweetness.
Cloudy orange color with a white head. Bready aroma with apricot and spice. Mildly bitter flavor. Lots more fruit and spice in the finish. Sparkly mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bottle. Pour is a slightly hazy copper with a white head, which quickly fades to nothing. Aroma of banana, clove, wheat malt, fruity esters, grassy hops. Taste is moderately sweet, wheat malt, big banana/fruity yeast presence. Palate is creamy, sticky, lively carbonation, big fruity/sweet finish. Very respectable.

Bomber, serves in my Aventinus weizen glass. The pour yields a hazy, glowing, deep golden amber body strewn with never-ending streams of effervescent bubbles. The off-white head is quick to fade, almost disappearing completely, leaving no trace of lacing behind. The nose explodes with notes of estery, smushed banana puree, zippy clove, and caramelized blonde wheat.  Flavors are mostly sweet, loaded with reduced and caramelized wheat, pan cooked banana, bread pudding, and very mild bitterness (more from earthen clove than from floral hops).  The palate is light on carbonation, smooth, and slimy up front. On the back end, it gets a little overly syrupy, leaving a lingering film in the mouth.  Overall, its a fine example of the style.  Too sweet for me, but I could drink a bit on occasion.

While not being a huge fan of this style, I really liked this!  On the pour, the colour is that of dull brass with a tight cap of dense foam that fades slowly.  Yeast and cloves dominate the aroma when cold, upon warming, the alcohol becomes more pronounced.  Up front the flavor is a little sweet and grassy like a good pilsener.  As it mingles with the tongue, it reverts back to its roots, clovey, yeasty, and tart.  The ending is my favorite part.  Notes of the hops and their peppery goodness make themselves known.  Quite creamy for a beer of this type with none of the spritzy character usually found here.  All in all a good brew from one of my favorite brewers.

Bomber poured a hazy orange amber with a small lingering amber head. Aromas of wheat, banana, clove and light yeast. Palate was medium bodied and smooth. Flavors of wheat, banana and clove with a smooth lingering banana finish.

Bottle. Pours a deep reddish amber, quite hazy and a billowy head. The nose on this is bananas and some sweetness. Hint of cocoa? really yeasty and banana forward, light bubblegum. On tasting, its big and sweet, overly so. Too much sweetness that just emphasizes the banana candy notes. The booze also is noted. Not a fan of this one.

The pour is a hazy dark orange with an average sized off-whit head.
The aroma has light banana, some spice and yeasty bread aromas.
The flavor starts a bit harsh and mellows out on the next swallows. The light sweetness is balanced with a light hop bitterness.  The alcohol is apparent and detracts somewhat.

Sampled on tap at 1702, Tucson, November 2011
Arrives from the tap with a fluffy, one-finger thick, pale tan colored head that is quite tight and creamy textured.  The beer is a clear, hazy, gold-straw color that shows more of the same, though a litte lighter, when held up to the light.  The aroma smells like an expressive HefeWeizen with notes of clove, soft banana, some softly tart wheat, hay like grain and sweet, honey-like malt notes.  This is quite nice and at first blush reminds me a lot of New Glarus Weizen (though this is a bit lower in alcohol than that one, despite that one being labeled as a regular HefeWeizen).

Soft and creamy feeling up front, it picks up some carbonic prickliness towards the middle, but finishes with a linger, light viscousness that sticks a bit to the palate.  The clove flavor really lingers in the finish, and there is also a spiciness to the finish that is accentuated by the phenolic clove character and even picks up a touch of peppery spiciness (though some of that is likely accentuated by the pizza I just had).  Hay like grain notes mix with a touch of herbal-honey like malt character and even a touch of seeming herbal hop character.  The hop character contributes a touch of bitterness that isnt quite biting.  Other traditional HefeWeizen notes of banana, a hint of tartness and a nicely rounded pale malt and wheat flavor also play a role here.

I doubt this beer was decocted, but it is big enough that it does mimic the rich malt character that traditionally decocted HefeWeizens achieve. This is definitely quite nice and I am really enjoying this beer right now.  The phenolics can get a touch spicy and plastic like (perhaps) in the finish at times, but this is reasonably held in check.  This has a surpisingly complex yeast character (coming from an American Brewery, hell even your typical German one) that I am really enjoying.
Hazy golden orange pour with small head. Aroma of caramel, bread and sweet fruit. Taste is quite sweet with cloves, caramel and banana coming through. Excellent mouthfeel. Really enjoyable beer.
On tap at Barley Johns Brew Pub. Pretty golden colour. Tasty and sweet. A very good beer. I wish I could buy a bottle of it.

Pours a caramelly burnt orange with a moderate fading white head.  Aroma of cloves, hay, toast, juicy fruit, hay, and slight caramel.  Flavor of doughy malt, cloves, hay, spice, grass, slight juicy fruit, earth, and peppery bitterness.  Finishes mild bitter and slightly hot with earthy flavors and the yeast drying out.  Nearly heavy mouthfeel, creamy carbonation, and moderate alcohol presence.  This might be the best Lagunitas beer Ive had!  Very well done, aside from a bit of heat.
On tap at Barley Johns, Minneapolis. Hazy reddish orange colour. Fruity aroma. Nice hefeweizen flavour with sweet citrus taste. Amazing beer.

Yet another iPhone review. Beautiful solid hazy apricot coloured brew with a small white cap that hugs the ring too soon. Excellent taste - I cannot taste the % but my brain knows its there. Banana and clove and then a blast of spices and bitterness ( that doesnt last), tangerine, wheat, tang, orange, goodness. Most sips came across quite rich. Really enjoyed the drinkability of this brew. Ill say that I was skeptical of Lags version of this but was instantly proven wrong. Ants.
Aromas of banana, apricot, yeast. Full bodied with bananas, citrus, cloves and yeast on the palate. Alcohol is noticeable on the finish, but otherwise nicely balanced.

Bottled. Wow, fantastic example of the style, amazing that the are out Germaning the germans.  Pours a light orangey brown with massive weizy head. Heavy banana/esthery smell. Same taste with nice malts, super well done.
Pours thick murky orange with a white head. Aroma is wheat, citrusy fruit, spicy clove, banana, and yeast. Flavor is sweet, citrusy, clove, with a nice bitterness to balance the sweetness
Slightly clouded yellow pour with a white head. Aroma is clove, sweet. Vert tasty beer- clove, sweet, yummy. Very refreshing. I like this a lot.

My only problem is the alcohol was a bit on the hefty and hot side.

Location: 22 oz bottle from Sparrow, 11/11/11


Aroma: The nose has some wheat malts, citrus/orange, banana, spice, and pineapple

Appearance: The pours is a cloudy bright orange color with a small, fizzy white head, and light lace

Flavor: The taste is rather well-balanced, some wheaty and fruity sweetness with a finish of hoppy bitterness

Palate: The body is medium-full, it has average-to-lively carbonation, a rich feel, and a fairly lengthy finish

Overall Impression: 
I thought about drinking this one at 11:11 on 11/11/11, but I thought maybe that was a bit too early?  Anytime I see a new one from Lagunitas, I usually pick it up, and this one was also recommended to me recently by jcos, so this was an obvious purchase.  Anyway, as for the beer, this stuff is very solid.  I really liked this one, well-balanced between sweet and bitter, and even just a hint of sourness.  Another good one from Lagunitas, good recommendation Kramer!

Bottle. Bright orange with som thick wispy cloudiness. Moderate head and some light lacing.  Big tangerine nectar aroma. Big flavour. Strong yeast character. Big tangerine note. Hard to believe 9%. Great tangerine, yeast and grain liqueur.

This was on tap at StrangeBrew at the Eureka Theater in Eureka, CA. Pours a cloudy orange amber with a nice off-white head with gold in the bubbles. Nose of lots of roasted wheat and a blast of banana and citrus.  Body is full and the mouthfeel is classic Lagunitas being slick and smooth with an almost oily touch. How do they do this to all their beers?  The flavor is way good, with banana, clove, rich malts, and a very favorable and spicy finish with a lot of clove.    The is just simply stupendous and another rousing success from this remarkable brewery.

Bottle.  Very hazy orange pour, with a white head.  Lots of banana, wheat, spicey yeast, and pretty damn sweet.  Not half bad actually for the style.  I just dont like the sweet banana weizen thing much anymore.

Bottle. Amber beer with a cream colored head. Banana and spice aroma with yeast and wheat. Caramel and spice flavor with banana, yeast, and wheat. Medium bodied. Caramel and spice lingers with banana, wheat, yeast, and light citrus.

22 oz bottle. Hazy orange with a small, thick, off white head. Aroma is heavy on the banana/clove with some wheat bread and caramel. Flavor is sweet and malty with a zesty yeast presence and a alcohol bite. Medium body with average to low carbonation and a thick, chewy mouth feel. Not my favorite style but still an alright beer, alcohol is a bit much though.

Bottle.  Cloudy gold pour with no head.  Sugary banana malt and spicy yeast in the aroma.  Flavor is the same; pretty full-bodied and sweet up front with the spicy yeast lingering in the background and into the finish.  Pretty good.

A cloudy golden color and a white head that stays around for a while but leaves very little lacing.  The aroma is mainly lemon zest with some yeast and a bit of orange.  The flavor is mainly dough and yeast with a nice amount of lemon, along with a smooth and somewhat spicy finish.

Pours a murky but inviting gold with thin wisps of white head on top. Very spicy aroma. Very yeasty, with some clove, coriander, ginger, and honey. Taste is both sweet and spicy. A lot of clove with a little bit of wheat tanginess. Very spiced. Lots of ginger flavor, with some coriander or cardamom taste coming through in the aftertaste. Almost a belgian yeast taste through the finish. Definitely more than just a touch boozy. Well-carbonated with a lingering spicy aftertaste. Not bad, but not their best offering. Too "Lagunitas" for me, meaning I dont think their extreme attitude really matches up with a nuanced style like a weizenbock. Still, drinkable, and well worth the low price of admission.
Pours a honeyish golden color. Great fruit and spice aroma. Flavor follows through with banana, apple, and clove. Super full bodied and smooth.

On Tap at Baileys, about 60F, thin sheet of foam, solid lacing, full golden color with orange hues around the edges.  Cloudy with a luminescence around the edges.  Aroma of grapes, candi sugar, pear, a generally fleshy fruit aroma, sugary and somewhat like clean spring water.  Definite alchohol in the nose, almost overpowering.  Flavor is golden wheat, a light acidic bite, alcohol, sugar, strong malt.  Mouthfeel is alcoholic, hot, lightly carbed, nearly fusel, very hot, alerts the brain to danger, exciting, arousing.  Very similar to some Belgians, reminiscent of Tripel Carmelite.  Variety of malts and raw grains.  Sugary.  Yeast by-products from hot ermentation.  Combine flavor with hot finish, lasting sugary character, so sweet it lingers on the lips, finishes on tongue and lips, reeks of danger.  All in all it is completely out of style.  For the style it has a terrible aroma, wrong palate, wrong taste.  But this is a sexy, risky beer, dangerous and exciting.  Overall this is the shit.

Poured a hazy dark orange color with a thin white head.  Aroma has lots of orange with some yeast and mint.  Alcohol is noticeable.  Taste is very flavorful with oranges and creamy malts.  Alcohol is well hidden in the taste.  Aftertaste has some sweet fruit and grapes.  Some slight cardboard flavors.  Overall pretty good!

650ml bomber pours a hazy golden orange color with a finger of white head which leaves some fine lacing behind.  Aroma is citrus and yeast.  Taste is grainy malted sweetness with huge citrus and a lingering bitterness.  This is one bold wheat beer and not for the faint of heart.  Mighty tasty.

This is a massive beer. The pour is a cloudy golden yellow with a thin off white head that leaves some superb lacing. The nose is wheaty and yeast predominant with a strong German spice and noticeable hop. The malts are nice and caramelly with a big wheat presence. In the middle, a nice sweet fruity yeast note with prevalent spice and orange citrus fruit. The wheat and light toasty malt is quite nice with a light touch of caramel. The finish is somewhat alcoholic with a prolonged spice from the yeast and a nice presence of bittering hop. A full body with an amazing drinkability for a 9% brew. Overall, Lagunitas hit the nail on the head with this brew.

nice full malty flavor to this light orange brew. banana spice flavor is fresh, light caramel sweet, and mellow yet still a little bright. carbonation is lively enough and the body is full enough because of the added warming in the brew. some alcohol in the nose and taste. nuance of fruit.

Bottle. Pours bright orange with a soapy off white head that fades to a calm brew. Aroma is sweet sugar and spice with a bready banana scent. Taste is again sweet bready artificial banana and spice with a syurp bitter finish. Palate is medium and subtle carbonation and finishes warmig and dry.

Bomber.  A big gold tinted head is half the glass during the pour.  The beer is effervescent orange and is cloudy.  Cloves, fruit, and yeast in the nose.  The flavor brings out a light hop spice but sugar, yeast, wheat, and funk are more prominent.  Alcohol is definitely noted.  Cloves are nice and malt is significant.  This is tasty.  Well done.
Pours a greyish orange color with a large, creamy, off white head. Notes of bananas, clove, candi sugar, and wheat. Sweet and creamy mouthfeel. Nice.

Pours a mildly hazy yellowish, on par for the style.  Nose is pretty muted... grainy banana sweetness, a bit of booze, some peppery hop notes.  Good, just not too pronounced.  Flavor improves a bit.  The typical hefe-ish banana sweetness form the nose dominates the flavor.  More hop character than is usual for the style (not surprising coming from Lag), with citrus and peppery notes, and pepper sharpness that lasts through the finish.  Relatively smooth on the palate, though the finish gets really heavy on the booze as it warms.
Overall, a suprisingly impressive attempt at a style Lag isnt known for

22oz. Bottle:  Aroma of wheat, banana, yeast, and cloves.  Poured a cloudy amber/gold in color with a tiny, tan head that disappeared almost immediately, except for around the edges.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Flavor is medium sweet and medium bitter.  Tastes of wheat, banana, fruit, clove, yeast, bubblegum, and some spice.  Medium body.  Slick, then dry texture.  Average carbonation.  Heavily sweet, medium bitter, banana, wheat, fruit, clove, finish.  9%ABV is completely hidden throughout.

22oz bottle.  Small off-white head atop cloudy amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, clove, banana, light cotton candy, bread.  Taste is moderately sweet, clove, some banana, alcohol, light cotton candy.  Medium body, light stickiness, low carbonation.

22 ounce bottle at the Brass Tap.  Poured a hazy orange color with a thick dense white head.  Aromas of wheat, bread, pepper, spices, and clove.  Flavors follow the aroma with a touch of banana, and some bubblegum.  Nice big alcohol beer that was a real good weizen bock, that I will drink again.

From bomber into Lagunitas jar glass. Hazy orange color, Nose is really just the usual German weizen, maybe with a touch more alcohol.Then in the taste, you get the huge body and flavor of alcohol. Flavor is overpowered by the alcohol, unfortunately--everything else about this beer is nice. Palate is super frothy--creamy.
22 oz bottle.  Pours an opaque orange with peach hues.  Aroma of peach, pear, lemon, spice, nutmeg, pepper.  Flavor is coriander, pear, citrus, pepper, floral.  An incredible brew.

A cloudy, orange-brown pour with a thin white head.  It has a pleasant wheat and light caramel aroma, with a touch of alcohol.  The medium body has a sticky texture with lively carbonation.  The taste is well balanced with mild sweetness.

Bomber.  Pours hazy and dull orange with a small light tan head.  Aromas of sweet yeast, bubblegum, cherry, and slight alcohol.  Flavor is bubblegum and sweet candi sugar, peppery yeast, and alcohol, with some dusty candy, cherry, and bitter grass in the finish.  Medium carbonation and body, and warming but not hot.  Sweet and tasty, pretty good.  [858]

22 oz. bottle.  A murky copper pour with a nicely sized beige head.  Overly ripe bananas, cloves, a little cinnamon, vanilla beans, caramel, and a touch of oakiness in the dessert-like aroma.  Medium-bodied and fairly sticky on the way down.  More and more syrupy as things warm up.  Caramel, candied sugar, bananas, and vanilla cream start things off taste-wise.  Banana bread in the middle.  A slightly grainy and semi-sour oakiness finishes things off.  Spicy all the way through with some cloves and hints of cinnamon.  A mild alcohol burn and some boozy warmth throughout.

Bottle. Pours hazed golden orange with dense white head. Aroma has lots of yeasty bread dough, banana and cloves, some sweet honey notes too. Flavors are nice and spicy good clove presence upfront, stiff banana middle, and long sweet hawian bread and floral hop finish. Med bodied. Some booze in here but not much. Similar to the hopfen beers. Good stuff for sure.

bottled. pours murkey yellow orange with almost no head. aromas of orange lemon clove and raisin. flavors similar. sweetness with a crisp acidic bite. light bodied, lively beer with a lasting finish of citrus rind astringency... pretty good.
Pours orange, smells very fruity.  Taste fruity as well, with maybe some banana bread flavors.  Good doppel weizen.

Serving: 22 oz. bottle.  It pours a cloudy, brownish orange with a small, off-white head.  The nose has a whole bunch of clove, some alcohol, and apple.  The flavor is malt heavy with a good bit of sweetness, lots of clove, and some yeast.  Medium to full body with lower than average carbonation.  This certainly isnt traditional Lagunitas, but it does strike me as traditional German and well done at that.

Bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a slight earthy orange hue and a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has lots of yeast and flora with some banana, clove and other spices. Flavor is quite sweet with banana and clove with some grains that come out in the finish and a earthy yeast note.

Bottle; poured a amber type color with a whitish head.  Aroma of wheat, banana, vanilla, sugar, ripe fruit.  Flavor had a pronounced banana flavor, with some good wheat, toasted, and a touch of sugar and fruit.  Alcohol comes out a bit in the end.  Good beer.A good beer in a style I like.

Thanks Judy! .. bought the same day as when i hung out with SugarNipples .. . Pours a orange light tan .. . almost no foam .. . a bit boozy, with lots of grain, wheat, cloves, and bruised intense banana . .. wall street is a good movie .. . this brew pulls you in quite a few directions, but the overdone booziness is what im left with, but i think this beer could do with maybe 6months to a year, maybe .. . . Man looks in the abyss, theres nothing staring back at him. At that moment, man finds his character. And that is what keeps him out of the abyss.

Bomber from Whole Foods.  Hazy orange-yellow in color with a one finger white head.  Pretty standard banana and wheat aroma with some orange/citrus and sweet malt.  The flavor is rather syrupy and sweet with bread and honey flavors and lots of banana, maybe some clove.  A bit syrupy on the mouthfeel with medium-plus body.  Cant say Im terribly impressed with this one.  Its all right.

The beer pours a hazy golden-orange color with a large white head. The aroma is very heavy on the bananas with some cloves and wheat also present. The flavor is similar with a few additions. The two predominant flavors are bananas and orange citrus, with some wheat and a little bit of cloves. There is also a low to medium amount of bitterness as well as some alcohol. Medium mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

You just cant beat the German versions of this style.  It has all the typical Bavarian like aromas and tastes.  Some alcohol burn.  Ok palate.  There is a slight sourness in the finish.  I get a cardboard like finish, too.  Not quite as balanced as I would like.
Pours a hazy dark orange. Initial aroma is a combo of spices and medicine. The taste carries that light cinnamon flavor over before it gets swamped by a harsh bubbly bite of vanilla and alcohol.

Malty, with notes of wheat and bready graham cracker above caramel, orange peel citrus and hops. Full, spicy finish, with rich and creamy honey notes throughout. A bit of heat on the finish but this is generally covered well, finishing with balanced hops.
Bottle. Cloudy orange pour with thick lasting white head. Full clove, wheat and banana aroma. Taste is banana, fresh bread and spice.  A bit of hop in the finish
user_location: Munchen an der Willamette, Oregon, USA

text: Bottle from Sams in Durham.  Pours cloudy golden-orange-tan. Not much of a head, which was a disappointment.  Nose of wheat, grain, ripe bananas, honey, and mild citrus.  Taste is similar, with more malt/grain presence and a slight alcohol kick.
Amber in color, slight haze with a thin white head.  Awesome sweet malt aroma.  Fruity and light bitterness.  Wheat flavors with good finish.  This was a very tasty brew.  Very interesting.

22oz bottle from Archers. Pours a cloudy copper with a medium white head that dissipates quickly. The aromas are bananas, butterscotch and clove. The mouthfeel is lively, slightly dry and has a medium body. Very nice beer.

22 oz. bottle, pours a completely opaque orange with about a fingers width of white head. Aroma of orange, banana, clove, toasted nuts, and honeyed malt. Flavour has lots of honey, banana, orange, clove, spicy yeast and floral hops. This sure is enjoyable - up there with the best of this style. Really well-made.
Purely even opaque orange with a white head.  Aroma of orange and clove, and taste is the same, with dialed-up wheat-wine booziness, and an orange pith bitterness in the finish.  $5/22oz

Murky orange pour, with a dense, but quickly fading white head. Nose has sweet citrus, caramel, and some bready yeast. Mostly thick, chewy malts in the flavor. Some booze... this is a weighty weizen! Tasty, but lacking balance.

UPDATED: MAR 21, 2017 Bottle.  Original rating in July 2011 and revisited in March 2017. Pours hazy orange with a small, fizzy white head, long retention with good lacing.  Aroma is banana, moderate spicy, earthy and grainy wheat malt, peppery cloves, light citrus notes and fruity esters of pear and apple.  Flavor is moderte spicy, earthy and grainy wheat malt, light banana esters, light citrus notes and a sweet finish.  Full body, moderate carbonation.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a big off white head. Fruity and yeasty aroma, with banana, clove, bread crust, and wheat. The flavor has sweet fruity banana, spicy yeast, toasted bread, honey, and some light flowery hoppy notes. Just a bit of alcohol peeks through, Id probably like this a bit better at around 7% ABV.
Hazy light amber, nice aroma of straw and light sweetness.  Flavor runs very wheaty and yeasty.  Nice finish too not bad.

On tap at Flying Saucer. Pours a cloudy yellow with small frothy white head and sticky lacing. The aroma is clove and banana. Medium mouthfeel with yeast and banana and nice dry finish. A good Weizen from Lagunitas.

Mmmmm gooood beeer. Poured with a nice, small to medium sized cream colored head that settled down to a ring after a few minutes and  no lace. Color is a hazy medium amber with some bubble trails. Aroma is lots of banana, malt, yeast, spice. Flavor is similar but yeast bitterness stands out too, kind unbalancing it a bit. Good tang. Body and carbonation are excellent. Finish is like flavor with only a hint of alcohol warming at the very end. Super effort towards a Bavarian Doppel Weizen.

Beautiful luminous tangerine bronze with lively carbonation and a bright, off-white, frothy head. Intense banana aroma trumpets from the glass encompassed by a sweet yeastiness. Banana yeasty flavor, but it veers toward green and soapy territory. Soapy-sour finish. Could benefit from some aging.

An average weizen bock. Aroma was so so. Heavy mango with hints of banana and bubblegum. Pour was a nice cloudy hazy orange with a one finger off white head. Taste was a little muddled and off, but not too bad. Wheaty tang, mango and just subtle hints of banana were in the front and a weird hoppy bitterness came in after the swallow. It didnt linger, but was enough to make the beer seem unbalanced. There was a nice sweet light malt backbone weaving in and out. Nice carbonation.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Orange pour, big white head. Aroma of very ripe bananas and oranges. Flavor is heavy banana, oranges and light hops.
Aroma is of bananas and Belgian candy sugar. Very pale for a doppel weizen. This actually finishes quite smooth while still letting you know it has a little something. Really really good.

22. Pours a cloudy bright medium amber with toffee colored edges. Dense creamy white head that falls away to a sudsy rim. Big sweet orange and wheat nose. Creamy medium body with modest carb. Sweet wheat and bright orange flavors on the mid palate. Pleasant but hardly complex or powerful by the standards of a 9% beast.

UPDATED: NOV 2, 2011 Brilliantly delicious!  Huge banana bread aroma on this one! Appearance is a cloudy yellow/orange. The taste is big breaded banana with a yeasty goodness. Big full body and lightly carbonated to produce good banana burps! Another great beer from Lagunitas.

Head is very light, no lacing at all; color is clean orange in sight.  Mouthfeel is very warm for a doppel weizen. Highly carbonated. Taste lingers lighly for a short time. Get more of hay/bread taste then the chocolate or coffee notes.. Overall I like the beer but not overwehelmed

Drank entire bottle last weekend. Aroma shares characteristics with the standard Lagunitas beer. Aroma is fruity, with notes of bready yeast and grains. Flavor is malty and wheat, caramel notes, slight sugar characteristics. Very drinkable, especially for 9% (yikes!).
Orange, very hazy, good white head.  Aroma and taste have a lot of good yeast funk to it - kind of a mushroom, earthy flavor.

22 oz bomber.  Pours a cloudy golden brown color with a medium size off white head.  Aroma of oranges, citrus peel, bubble gum, Belgian yeast cloves and orange marmalade.  Taste of orange marmalade, cloves, Belgian yeast, bubble gum and hops.  Very good stuff.
(22oz bottle)  Pours a cloudy golden body with a medium white head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma of banana, bread, nuts, caramel, and toffee.  Flavor of banana, clove, bread, orange, and toffee.

22 oz. bottle, $6 at Binnys. Poured into a Goose 312 wheat glass after sitting a while in the freezer this evening. Only effect seems to be the bubbles still clinging to the sides. Pours a kind of dirty yellow, barely translucent. head is gone very quickly. Hard to get a handle on the smell, it seems a bit, I dunno, sickly, like Fat Tire? Taste does redeem it, seems all the smell was being masked by cold alcohol. Some banana and clove esters with a doughy malt base. A very noticeable malt coating on the inside of the glass. Im warming up to it as it warms up. In fact, Im feeling the effect without tasting too much alcohol. This may be one of those styles that really, really doesnt need to be pushed up to "11." Or in this case, "9."

This is right there with Aventinus for me. Clean, malty, crisp, and delicious. Could be the best American weizenbock I have ever had, or the best overall. I like this a lot, shocking style for the brewery, and it was incredible.

Pours a hazy yellow/orange with a decent weizen-like white head.  Aroma is yeast, banana and clove.  Tastes like most good hefeweizens, but more astringent and assertive at 9% ABV.  Pleasant yeasty sweet pale malt flavor, along with the obligatory banana, clove and coriander flavors shine through.  Very decent effort at a strong hefeweizen!

Bottle.  A hazy orange amber color with a white head.  A very nice weizen aroma with candied sugars, citrus, banana, clove.  A nice peppery spice on the palate with banana and clove at the finish.  A noticeably strong beer with a lot of character.

This beer is very tasty. Clove, banana and buttery. Lagunitas uses hop extracts and this has a low IBU so they arent overbearing. I do detect extract in the flavor. I would rank this as one of their best beers ever. I am skeptical that they used 100% real ingredients in this brew. Even if they didnt it is delicious. I wish all brewers had to put the exact ingredients in the beer on the label. Now this is strange? I need another one. Prost!!

Lagunitas
Bavarian Doppelweizen
Pours hazy medium gold with a huge white head and piles of retention. Aroma is sweet with a boozy Belgian maltiness (yes it is a German beer, but it sure smells Belgian. Perfumy with notes of Allspice. Flavor is boozy and spicy from the German (Saaz?) hops with a mildly grapefruit tangy finish. Really good and super well priced ($4.69 for a 22oz.) Yet another reason why Lagunitas is one of the best breweries out there.

Poured from the growler I bought at the brewery, into my Lagunitas Glass. Pours a nice hazy orange colour. nice head and decent lacing on the glass. aroma is of banana and clove as to be expected. flavour is excellent!! Overall a great Belgium from a great brewery!!!

Whole Foods, P st, DC bomber ($5): Pours a hazy orange color with a white head that goes away quite quickly. Aroma is of clove, banana, yeast, and sugar. Taste is a little sweet and a little sour. Aftertaste remains for a bit after drinking it. Body is pretty well done and this is pretty easy drinking for a weizen bock. Very mild bitter notes somewhere around the middle of the beer. Has aspects of it that are almost similar to a tripel or another Belgian style ale. Well done. As usual, Lagunitas fails to disappoint.

Bomber from Capones.  Pours very thick and turbid vivid orangy straw colored with 2-finger well-retained and uniform off-white head.  Nose is malty, clovey spice, peppery, funky yeast, lime, Bazooka gum.  Tastes citric, very malty, clovey, with a big rock sugary yeasty flavor, a rich and complex palate, and a strong finish.

Aromas of cloves, allspice and soft wheat rise off a cloudy orangy-yellow body with a fluffy white head.  Creaminess initially fills the taste followed by the cloves and some banana, then a warming alcohol burn.  As this fades a caramel sweetness and dry graininess replaces it, and it all washes out with more marshmallow creaminess.  Theres some sour yeastiness around the sides of the tongue too.   Tasty!

Pours cloudy golden orange with two fingers of off white head. Nose is sharp and phenolic, lots of clove and spice with some fusel alcohol and a heavy banana bread character. Flavor is a tad astringent, clove or hops or something stays on the tongue.  Sharp and spicy alcohol, where this bite comes from I do not know.

22 oz. bottle from Total Wine - Pours a hazy golden color with a 2/3 finger thick off white head.  Aroma is esters and yeast.  Flavor is pretty much the same.  The flavor really lingers.  Almost cloying.  Medium body.  It was kinda tuff to finish the whole bottle.  Worth a try.

Im really liking Lagunitas now. Ive had 20 of their beers and have always found them respectable--strangely sweet and balanced despite their tendency to follow the rest of the West Coast in competing for bigness. But this beer really solidified it. A hazy, rich-looking beer shows considerable balance and warm malts to balance the mega-Germanic hops. Good, satisfying beer for the Autumnal season. And classical Lagunitas prices, too! Good deal. Bottle.

Pour is a hazy orange with a small white head.  Aroma is a very nice clove-banana yeastyness.  Flavor is much the same.  Big cloves with bananas and a vanilla coats the tounge.  A little sweet but hids the alcohol well.  This is a well done beer and as always Lagunitas is always on the cheaper side so this is a deffinate pick up.

Bomber:  Appearance is a cloudy orange pour with a thick white head that lingers.  Aroma is nice banana, clove, light fruits, maybe some grassy hops in the backing, but a nice Hefe scent that is quite enjoyable.  Taste is like a really nice hefe.  Banana, clove, coriander, and the slightest amount of hop notes.  Only downside is a slight alcohol bite on the back end.  Palate is nice carbonation in the mouth, medium to full bodied, lively and somewhat astringent on the finish.  Overall,  if they covered up the alcohol more this would be a really nice brew, but I like it.  Just not stellar.  Cheers!

22oz bottle 10/14/11 (Binnys Downers Grove)-42° in Weizen Glass-Pours a murky orangish amber with a big two finger off white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, smoke, and clove. Taste of the same with a bit more banana, clove, honey, and slight alcohol. This light to medium bodied brew is well balanced and goes down really smooth. Great brew.

It pours perfect cloudy thick lemon orange in color with a big creamy white head and nice retention. The aroma is sweet and yeasty, powerful in the nose. The flavor is similar, yeasty with big bready and sweet notes. The ABV is apparent for the style, but the sweetness helps balances it out nicely.

Great aroma - fruity wheat malt.  Good label on a good bomber bottle, apricot colored beer that is very foggy.  White head that collapses to a filmy lace. Woody alcohol flavors pretty much dominate, not as sweet as it smells.  Pretty bitter, especially as it gets warmer.  Thick but effervescent mouthfeel.  Well done, but not my style.  Market Square Liquors, Timberlane.

22oz bottle from Whole Foods Tampa.  Pours a hazy, fizzy yellow with orange highlights and a white receding head.  Nose is huge banana notes both green and yellow with some black and some plantain alongside boozy honey.  Flavor is also a ton of banana with some bread, honey, and a yeast presence in the finish.  A bit boozy for something weizen, but all together a sweet but interesting experience in this light to medium-bodied sweet banana weizen bock.

22 oz bottle shared by EZAnt. Poured a solid orangey body with a smaller foamy white head. Aroma of bubblegum, sweet dough, touch of clove, yeast some wet wheat. Medium to full body with strong carbonation. Flavor is much like the aroma with lots of bubblegum, some banana and clove, pepper and spices. Meh this one isnt doing it for me.

Iam impressed by this beer!
taste Hop profile stood out alittle in this Weizen bock, it went well with the banana yeast flavor imparted, good smooth malt background, neat taste, very interesting!
smell, Flora yeast comes out, ripe banana, some carmel and toasted malts
appearence, amber hue, very pleasing to the eye.
overall, I liked this Weizen bock though Iam not a strong fan of this style, I like this brewers stuff, and I loved this brew!
user_location: @RED BHUT JOIKIAS!, Paulsboro, New Jersey, USA

text: Pours more yellow compared to the labels depiction. Cloudy with a decent head of lightly off white color. Unlike some bocks there is a more noticeable hop profile to go along with the yeasty banana and clove. Smooth on the palate as well although slightly coating

Bottle. Deep, hazy golden pour with a frothy white head. Strong malty aroma. You can sense the alcohol as well. Definitely comes across as a hef on steroids. Amazing taste. Sense the alcohol and a great mix of malt with some lemon zest in the background. Really, really good beer from Lagunitas.

Bottle from BevMo: Poured a beautiful glowing yellow that appeared muddy with haze as a delicate topping of white foam sat firm on top. In the aroma, a heaping dosage true authentic German yeast dominates my nose with such scents as banana, bubblegum, c love, and pepper come to mind. The flavor is matched by the aroma except the spices become more apparent and even add some more tastes such as lime leaf, lemon zest, coriander and a funky aftertaste of mouthwash.

I want to like this beer a lot.  Its aroma, appearance, and initial taste are all very nice.  Love the caramelly banana-clove profile.  However, the overly present hop notes that linger on the palate are severely distracting.  They just shouldnt be present to this degree in a beer of this style, and they definitely shouldnt linger.  Overall I like it fairly well, but this beer could have been amazing and just seems to have gotten in its own way.

Hazy straw yellow with a luscious foam heavy. Mellow wheat malt aroma. Strong banana flavor. Some spicy bready notes. Good clean mineral water is evidently used. This makes my fall day. Nothing bit delicious satisfaction. That should be the name of their next beer.

22oz bottle.  Cloudy orange pour. White foam.  Syrupy pour.  Aroma of fruit.  Tropical fruits, banana peel, toasted wheat malt, vanilla, distant pineapple as well.  First sip, (wruagh) very strong.  Flavor of wheat, bitter hop oils left on the lips, some tangy fruit, and spicy clove.  It is strong.  This one is gonna light me up.  It will be ok, it is a good representation of a style I admire.  Whoa.

On the nose, tons of yeasty goodness. Intense cloves and spice. Pours a murky orange with a bubbly white foam head. Flavor is interesting. You get the typical hefeweissen flavors, banana, a little bit of bubblegum, and alot of spice. Sharp spice with some alcohol heat behind it. I even taste some butter in the middle. Finishes with some nice hops and more spice. Another solid beer from Lagunitas.

Bottle from Beer Run in Charlottesville, VA. Pours a very hazy orange with a thin fizzy white head. Poor head retention. Aroma of banana, pineapple, wheat and a spicy clove finish. The taste is banana, clove, spice, caramel, pineapple, toasted malts and a bitter finish. Medium-full bodied with strong carbonation.

Hazy orange-copper color with a small off-white, lightly lacing head. Aroma of clove, banana, toast and light citrus. The taste is rich, sweet, yeasty, a touch bitter and a touch boozy. The body is medium-full and sticky, the carbonation is  average and theres a bit of a numbing alcohol/dryness at the finish. Theres nothing thin about this, but there isnt anything overdone either. Well done.

(22oz bottle from Total Wine Hillcrest).  Pours an orange-copper color with off-white head.  Aroma has clove, banana and wheat.  Taste is sweet with clove and banana being prominent.   Medium bodied with a sticky texture.  Smooth finish with the alcohol well-hidden.  Really nice beer.

Shared thanks EzAnt. Pours out an orangy golden color with a thin white head. Aroma is of banana, some light spice, and sweet grainy notes. Taste is much the same, bread, some banana, spice, grainy sweet finish with light alcohol coming through.

Bomber from Market Square.  Big white head w/ lots of retention.  Pleasant aroma of banana, bread and light spices.  Taste is spicy, sweet burned brown sugar, banana, clove, caramel and alcohol.  Warm spicy yeasty finish.  Everything well balanced.  I like this beer.  The spices knock down the overly sweet stuff I normally object to with the style.

Bottle: &nbsp Dark straw, orangish, moderate to large frothy white head, spotty lacing. &nbsp Nose seems citrusy. &nbsp Faint clove and banana. &nbsp Alcoholic banana breadiness up front, faint clove on the backside. &nbsp Backside seems citrusy. &nbsp This is an odd one, hoppy nose, German Hefe like start, then again with some citrusy hops on the backside, in addition to the yeasty, banana, and clove. &nbsp Its like a sweet citrusy hoppy German Hefe. &nbsp Granted, it seems very American. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Its an odd duck, that works. &nbsp The alcohol is a bit noticeable tho.

Very good doppelbock. The waitress just said doppelbock at the restaurant, and it wasnt until I went in to go to the bathroom did I see that it was from lagunitas. Bright orange color, smell is of bubbelgum and oranges, tastes pretty much the same. Very good.

Pours a hazed golden with a whit head. Aroma is bready doughy clovey esthery yeasts, bread, banana, malt, sugars, caramel. Flavor is quite sweet with dough, yeast, banana, bread, cloves, spices. Slightly syrupy and a good touch of honey and alcohol up front with banana and spices in the finish. Beer Dessert. MmMmm.
Too much of an herbal/medicinal taste, it just doesnt work well. Apart from that you got the typical hefe yeast flavors. Not bad, but not well made.

Pours a dark amber color with a small white head that lasts throughout and leaves some lacing. Aromas of banana and booze. Flavors of banana, cloves and bready malt. Medium-bodied with a creamy mouthfeel and a slight tinge of alcohol. Nice beer.

Classic wheat aroma from the neck. Pours hazy orange with a frothy big bubble head. Aroma of fruit, grain, bready, and a bit of an alcohol note. Has a VERY sweet smell. Malt & wheat taste, finishes light and surprisingly clean considering the haze and legs. Notes of banana, carmelized sugar, and pepper? A bit of a hop bitterness, but really fairly well balanced except for the higher ABV in the middle. Not being a wheat beer fan, I was attracted to this beer because of the higher ABV and it does not dissappoint. Not a huge flavor bomb, but very drinkable, enjoyable offering from Lagunitas. tasted @ 61F.

Location/Date:Bottle on October 6th, 2011.
Appearance: Pours a nice orange copper haze with some light head. 
Aroma: Aroma is doughy like a hefeweizen, slightly sweet.
Taste: Tastes like a maltier hefewiesen. Somewhat sweet but somewhat slightly sour from the malt.
Palate:Medium body, a little fizzy, longer aftertaste.
Summary: I dont know if it fits within the weizen bock category, but I really enjoy this beer due to its taste, and it covers alcohol well.

Bottle. Pours with a very murky golden orange hue with a large, bone hued white head. Good lace and pretty decent retention. Aroma from a mile away is ripe banana. Upon closer inspection: ripe banana, vanilla, 4VG (clove) - lighter end of things, cardamom, and quite a bit of a grainy wheat character. Esters and a bit of fusel alcohol. Bready and biscuity, light caramel. Besides the somewhat harsh alcohol, this smells quite good!  Flavors fall a bit short. Lots of vanilla and banana esters. Sharp, somewhat solvent and lightly peppery alcohol notes. Really nice bready and perhaps slightly too caramely/caramelized notes. Minimal phenol. A slight bitterness towards the back of the tongue in the finish that I cannot place (doesnt seem to be hop based). Creamy carbonation, somewhat light bodied for what I was expecting. Warming. Alcohol is just a too harsh on this one. Beautiful yeast notes otherwise and a very nice malt character. Very close to very amazing. Good as it is.

Bomber from the Roseville BevMo. Pours orange amber with a slight off-white head. Roasty toasty wheat/malt with a bunch of citrus and yeast/spice. And banana, damn it. Not getting identifiable clove tho. Very full bodied. And the clove is quite intense, followed by a lot of slightly over-ripe banana. We got enough of those around our house, I have no doubt. Its rich malt with clove, banana and some burning bitter - which might be the clove. Just when I wondered whether these guys had lost the magic touch - bam!!!!!!!! Forgive me for doubting. Brilliant ale.

hazy golden with mininal lasting head.  nose of cloves more than esters.  thick mouthfeel before some tangy whear flavors and a lot of clove esters, the residual sweetness is appropriate for the abv and style, while the alcohol is subdued due to an excellent ferment.  very nice and immediately drinkable for such a huge beer

Pours very hazy orange/ golden color. Distinct smell of wheat and sweet scent I cant put my finger on. Taste is rich of wheat and felt thick and syrupy. Lots of flavor of wheat, caramel hint and maybe even banana?? Maybe thats the smell I cant figure out. Overall was impressed
Hazy light orange color/ ivory head. Mildly tart bready wheat, banana, caramel, spicy peppery clove aromas. Medium body. Rich dark bread, fruit cake, banana, clove, yeasty malty flavors--most tasty
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: There are just way too many fragrances in this brew to identify them all! The same goes with all the flavors!! Dry, spicy, and fruity-sweet from start to finish. Love the light alcohol fragrance/taste throughout. This brew has a great zing on the palate on the finish from the alcohol that is very pleasing and warming. Very flavorful and one I highly recommend anyone to try!

Bottle:  The aroma consists of moderate bubblegum, light banana, clove, and a touch of citrus.  It pours a hazy, not quite cloudy, golden orange with a small off-white head that quickly settles to a thin film.  The flavor starts with orange and lightly tart lemon.  Theres a moderate caramel presence in the middle.  The finish has moderate bubblegum, light banana, and light clove.  There is no sign of the 9%.  Medium bodied moderate carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.  Overall, its a tasty Weizen Bock, but the caramel flavor mid-pallet is a little too heavy for my preferences.  Definitely worth drinking again, but tone the caramel down a little it would be top notch in my opinion.

Lots of banana-clove esters typical of Belgian yeasts on this one. Nice amber body with almond-colored head. Taste is slightly nutty and biscuity as the initial banana-clove notes subside. Nice smooth finish that provokes the palate for more of the same intoxicating malty-clovenana-goodness.

Hazy orange in color.  Great hefe nose.  Full of spice, yeast, citrus, biscuit, and an acidic twang.  Big citrus, orange, lemon, yeasty esters and spice, fresh bread, mild alcohol, and a decent spicy hop bitterness on the tail-end. Trailing bitterness and acidity.  Medium-medium full body for a weizen style.  Loving this for $4.50 a bottle.

Aroma consists of clove, banana and earth. The appearance is a hazy "Bert" colored orange. The flavor is rather sweet, with some notes of bacterial infection shining through. The palate has only a slight tinge of carbonation and is medium bodied.

Pours hazy gold into a Sam glass. White head with good retention recedes leaving no lacing to skim surface. Bubblegum and banana aromas. Sweet dark caramel, bubblegum and bananas from front to back. Dry sweet banana flambe finish.

Pours a cloudy orange with almost no head. Nose and taste are of spice, muted hop, and pale malts. Mouth feel is more carbonated that it should be I think. A bit of booze. Another solid $5 bomber. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy orange with a quickly dissolving white head. Very nice aroma of wheat, oranges and alcohol. Crisp taste reminiscent of fall, October. If you like this beer, you will be doing yourself an injustice if you dont try Celebrator by Ayinger. Overall, a good doppel weizen. Ill try again.

Pours a murky, layered plum orange with little to no head.  Nose is strong with banana, over-ripe cantaloupe, bubble gum, vanilla, sugar.  Flavor is dirty bitterness, some banana, vanilla, bubble gum.  Very messy and a strange bitter taste.  Needless to say, not a fan.
Pours cloudy orange-ish.  Aroma is sweet bready malts and bubblegum.  Tastes of banana, sweet brown bread, bubblegum and a little wheat.  A little oily on the palate but certainly enjoyable.
Bottle from pikapp327.  Murky orange pour with a big white head.  Aroma is bananas, a little citrus, and wheat.  Taste is heavy clove, a little alcohol, lots of banana and citrus, and a great finish.

Bottle courtesy Fratto/pikapp327. Pours a very cloudy light orange color with a light layer of foam. Aroma is yeasty, citrus and banana with some clove notes. Nice banana split nose. Flavor is spicy, sweet fruit with citrus and banana. Nice flavor, quite smooth. I like this.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2011 Hazy orange with good, creamy, off-white head / Nose of malt, orange, candied banana, coriander, and clove / Full body, moderately sweet and sticky, with very good hop balance and long, lightly bitter, finish / Big, perfumed, flavors of orange, banana, pineapple, violets, resin, sour malt, clove, and coriander / Not usually a fan of weizens, big or not, but this one is a beauty.

Bottle.Pours a thick, lively cheddar yellow with a head that would make Asanthe Shiamcoe cry out "Shrinkage!"  Nose is a spicy and buttery clove with a quick infusion of banana.  Flavor is a barrage of boozy and earthy grain-fed clove and banana pulp.  Thick on the tongue.  Too earthy and blunt for my taste.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: UPDATED: MAR 28, 2012 Aromas of bananas and yeast. A bright golden color with a white head. Fruity bread flavors with just a little bit of alcohol on the finish, not much though for this strong of a beer. It is more resinous than similar beers in true Lagunitas fashion

Aroma is Belgian, clove, banana, apricot, citrus, bubblegum. Appearance is hazy apricot with light tan head. Taste is Belgian, clove, banana, citrus, much bitter orange peel, apricot, alcohol, bubblegum. Palate is medium full. Bitterness/orange peel lingers and almost overpowers other flavors. Overall an interesting beer, but a little too much bitterness overpowering other desirable flavors. A little boozy also. Still nice and worth a try.

The yeasty character of this makes me think of Schneider Wiesse/Aventinus.  Nice and thick, cloudy but not heavy golden liquid.  Heavy yeasty body with spicy notes and a whiff of chocolate.  Extremely tasty.
Bomber from Bevmo. Pours very hazy. Strong yeasty nose. Good spice presence, with a little sweetness. Full flavores. Sweet and wheaty. Cloves and bubblegum. A hint of alcohol. Slick full mouthfeel.

22oz bottle. Pours a cloudy, slightly darker orange-golden colored body with an inch thick, dense and foamy, off-white head that dissipates slowly and leaves a nice lacing. Aroma is slightly sweeter bubble-gum and wheat bread with a bigger banana. A bit of a yeasty spice with some clove and a light citrus. Flavor is similar. Sweeter and bready wheat malts up front with a big banana. Some bubble-gum, clove spice, citrus, and yeast. A few esters and phenols kick up at the end as this finishes fairly sweet, but it dries nicely with a light, yeasty and somewhat clove spiced bitterness. Fairly lengthy aftertaste following a very smooth and creamy, medium body and a soft, moderate carbonation. Overall, a pretty solid beer. Very smooth with a somewhat sweet wheat bread and a very pleasant banana and clove spice. A light citrus keeps it interesting as does the bubble-gum. Enjoyable.
Bottle.  Cloudy dark yellow with a creamy white head.  Huge vanilla, malt, banana bread, and more vanilla aroma and taste.  Nice creamy palate.  Yummy.

22oz bottle.
Cloudy orange with a decent amount of foamy head.  Aroma is grainy and fruity with some banana and wheat.  Flavor is slightly sweet with bubble gum, clove, banana, and some wheat bite.  ABV is well hidden.
bottle, thick orange color with minimal foam , fruity juicy fruit aroma, flavor is big banana, bubble gum, wheat bread, jelly doughnuts, nice beer

Pours hazy amber color with off white head. Aromas of fruity esters, wheat, dough and candi sugar. Very sweet with flavors similar to aromas. Medium to full body with minimal carbonation and a syrupy mouthfeel.

A straw-colored haze beer with a big creamy head. Aroma is big fruity estery fermentation notes with yeast and spice. Flavor is bready and a little funky. Nice refreshing smooth mouthfeel, no trace of the 9%. Good beer.

22oz bottle in a weizen glass.  Pours golden/orange with a thick, fluffy, white head.  Aroma strong of wheat, a little caramel and cereal maltiness, and some floral, slightly citrusy hops.  Flavor about the same with the wheat dominating.  Average texture.  A pretty good beer for the style.
This wonderful beer that smells of bananas and cloves. It is unfiltered and golden yellow in color with a particular taste that resembles a light begian golden ale. Another winner for Lagunitas.

Hazy Orange with billowy white head that leaves quick. Big of Nose of Bananas and hidden citrus hops. Light body. More big bananas, caramel and honeyd malts in the front disappear towards spiciness,wheat, citrusy hops and alcohol. Bitter spicy finish.

Something different from Lagunitas

22 ounce bottle - $4.29 at Total Wine & More in Alpharetta, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours a clouded, darkened orange body with a small, short-lived, pure white head.

Smell: Sweet-scented, tangy-accented wheat malts with a generous helping of cloves, mashed-up nanas, some wafting traces of alcohol, and even some bitter orange rind.

Taste: Sharply sweet, a bit sugary even (like doughnut glaze), atop some bready, honeyed malts. Twangy wheat flavor, a bit grainy, but quickly the heavily phenolic, clove-like spiciness shoves that noise right oughta the way, which itself is firmly butted up against the warm alcohol giving a drip of 99 Bananas. Some orange peel hints that, like the banana esters pairing with the alcohol, also hits the booze, hinting at Cointreau, soon becoming belly-warming. A drop of vanilla cream. A few Chiclets. Sweetish, fruity finish. Quite heated at the tail end.

Mouthfeel: Medium-plus body. Medium-plus carbonation.

Overall: Not as well-rounded and refined as its German counterparts; its kind of a slow sipper. Might be one to let sit in the bottle for a bit. Still, its a decent beer, not great, no, but is available at a comparatively lovely price (God bless ya for it, Lagunitas).
Poured a beautiful hazy amber colour with a thin but lasting head. Spicy with nice hop background and well hidden alcohol.

Bottle from kegs and barrels.  Pours a cloudy copper with a medium white head that dissipates quickly.  The aromas are bananas, butterscotch and clove.  The mouthfeel is lively, slightly dry and has a medium body.  Very nice beer.  Cheers!

Tallahassee, Fl - New Leaf Market - 22 oz bomber. Murky, medium orange pour with a sticky clingy white head that leaves a hint of lacing. Fresh bubblegum and cloves aroma. Flavor is full-bodied and rich with a strong dollop of ripened bananas, bubblegum and yeast. Belly warming and satisfying. Mouthfeel is sticky and rich. Interesting departure for Lagunitas.... not a hop-induced ale.

22 oz bottle. Pours a cloudy deep yellow with creamy white head. Aroma of strong banana, clove, wheat with notes of citrus. Flavor is much the same with hints of black pepper and alcohol spiciness. Mouthfeel is medium-heavy with soft body and high carbonation. Overall, very solid brew!

(bottle)  Pours a very hazy orange color with a thin white head and minimal lacing.  The aromas not bad, and possesses most of what youre looking for in a weizenbock, with plenty of banana, clove, and bubblegum scents, but there are also some scents which are quite unexpected such as canned salmon and another that smells reminiscent of methane.  The fruity and spicy scents do a good job of keeping these at bay, but they do lurk underneath the surface and emerge from time to time.  Flavor is pretty straightforward, and is far better than the aroma, with plenty of caramel to start things, followed up by a good amount of banana and even some peach.  The finish brings some crisp wheat, but this unfortunately descends into a metallic twang that I did not care for.  Booze burns a bit as well which doesnt help matters.  Overall this is an ok beer with a few significant flaws, but for the price its not too bad at all.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Weizen glass.

Appearance: Cloudy but bright orange with billowing foamy white head.

Aroma: Massive banana and bubblegum, with some clove, wheat and spicy noble hops.

Taste: Similar to the aroma, with loads of sweet banana and bubblegum, at least at first. Then the hops and clove come in and provide some great balance. Ends with lingering pepper and clove.

Palate: Creamy full body with moderate carbonation. Surprisingly dry finish after the initial sweet onslaught.

Overall: This is a great Weizenbock, and I seriously do not know what is wrong with the reviewers to date. I usually do not like it when Lagunitas steps away from their hoppy comfort zone, but this is incredible.

Pour is a bright opaque Orange with little white head. Smell is big bananas with clove and sweet tangerines. Taste is banana nut clovey muffins with burnt brown sugar on top. Good America German beer.

9/21/11. 22oz bottle. Hazy orange pour with a nice creamy tan head that sticks and laces nicely. Fruity, yeasty aroma with big, spicy phenolics. Sweet, bready entry with nice soft wheat, a touch of tang, creamy bananas, and more big spice. Not bad!

Bottle - 22 oz. Pours a cloudy yellowish amber color. Aromas of citrus, bananas, hay, and some bready malt. Wish it tasted as good as it smelled, but this one just didnt do it for me. Tasted barely of the "weizen" family... light sweet flavors of caramel, but followed by a slightly bitter hop finish. Was expecting a more tarditional german style, but knowing its Lagunitas, I should have expected the hoppy overtones. Carbonation is low, but high abv is noticeable and it becomes more like numerous other strong ales out there the more sips you take. Decent beer, but was expecting something more/ different.

22oz bottle.  thick, viscous, honey-like pour that has a very cloudy appearance in the glass under a small, creamy, white head.  sweet, robust nose of dough and banana.  palate is fittingly full, but a bit over-carbonated for me.  flavors of banana, a hint of alcohol, a twist of grapefruit bitterness i didnt see coming judging from the aroma, marshmallow and doughy yeast.

Bottle.  Nice hazy dark orange pour, a little carbonation and a very banana forward aroma.  Flavor is slick bready banana, sweet and very alcoholic on the aftertaste.  I can see this beer being a lot better if they dialed back the alcohol content.

650 ml bottle from bevmo. Pours a cloudy yellow color with a small white head that quickly dissipates to a fine film. The aroma is rich with fruity wheat, bread and cloves. The taste is more of the same, lots of banana, sourdough bread and mild spices(cloves). The palate is full and creamy with lively carbonation. Finishes long and dry with a bit of tang. Overall: Great beer.

22 oz bottle @ redlight redlight.  banana and clove on the nose.  Pours an orange color with a dissipating white head.  Banana upfront with clove spiciness following, first sip i get traditional Bavarian flavors, second sip the hops kick in, grassy citrusy hops.  Not bad.

$4 in South Oregon.  Pours a lovely cloudy light oranged yellow color.  Nose is quite malty with hints of clove ice cream.  Flavor runs very Bavarian Hefe style with mild hints at banana and little bits of sweet cream somehow.  Most of the flavor is dominated by the clove aspect, which hits in the body and finishes out the beer, lingering heavily - more than your average Bavarian Hefe, but its kind of nice!  All in all, its good...could be a bit thicker in the body, but I like it!  Nice to see Lagunitas continually doing different things - AND keeping their price at $4 a 22oz!

22 oz bottle ftom Roths Sunnyside Market in S.Salem. $3.99
Lovelly cloudy orange beer, with a large thick creme coloured head. Nice looking beer in my half liter Germen mug
Aroma is of yeast ,spices ..phenolic,leather  and earth  nice stuff.
Thick semi bitter..spicy,peppery, alcoholic, slightly nutty fine.
Nice an smooth on the palate..low carbonation.
Nice sipping beer..you can tell this is 9%

22 oz. bomber.  Opaque, reddish orange pour with a medium offwhite head that dissipates.  Aroma of yeasty belgian esters, mild bread dough.  Yeasty belgian esters of clove, banana, bubblegum.  Flavor is mildly sweet, with a twang of belgian yeast, clove and bubblegum blend in with doughy malts.  A strong sweetness thats similar to donuts or pastry.  Medium bodied, average carbonation.   I feel like this beer is trying to get to something that it never really reaches.  It just of fizzles out in the runway.

22oz bottle.  Pours a hazy golden orange with small bubbly head.  Nose is predominately sweet: banana, candied sugar, along with clove, pepper, and a hint of booze.  Flavor is more yeasty, spicy with banana and syrupy maltiness.  Thick, slightly sticky, not overwhelmingly carbonated, definitely bigger than I expected.

Draught at Lagunitas Brewery.
Orange-amber with lace. Lemon and sweet orange aroma, with clove and wheat. Very sweet flavor, with orange, lightest banana, clove. Strong alcohol, with a silky, oily body. Packs a big punch but is a bit unrefined.

22oz bottle from The Davis Beer Shoppe. The aroma is heavy on clove and banana yeast esters. Plenty of bubble gum is present, too. Light underlying tartness.  Mostly hazy honey colored body with a nice white head that is fairly strong. Starts sweet with bubble gum notes, before a little clove estery flavors take over in the middle. This takes on some dusty and husky wheat character later on. Light spicy character to finish with more underlying sweetness persisting.

Bottle...  Poured hazy yellowish/orange with a white head.  Nose had loads of yeast phenols with clove, bananas, and other spices.  Thick body, loads of carbonation with notes of vanilla, wheat malts, sugary-bready malts, banana bread, candied sweetness, light fruits, yeast tanginess, cloves, and a phenolic finish. A little alcohol crept int but overall pretty smooth for the ABV.

Hard to believe this hasnt been reviewed yet. On the brewerys website. Bottle from Belmont Station. Dont know what the Weissen spice is but its in the aroma, cotton candy, alcohol. Mild sourness in the flavor, lemon and peach, alcohol,a mild version of the chemical taste you get in malt liquors, and an edge of hops.Hazy warm yellow with insistent creamy white head. Chewy presence in the mouth, substantial.
